system.c

00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         system.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     All operating system dependent system services. This
00007                 file containt routines which hide all system specific
00008                 behaviour to higher levels. This is done by con-
00009                 ditional compiling using the OS_xxx variable defined
00010                 in MIDAS.H.
00011 
00012                 Details about interprocess communication can be
00013                 found in "UNIX distributed programming" by Chris
00014                 Brown, Prentice Hall
00015 
00016   $Id: system.c 5181 2011-08-29 12:23:25Z ritt $
00017 
00018 \********************************************************************/
00019

00060 INT ss_set_async_flag(INT flag)
00061 /********************************************************************\
00062 
00063   Routine: ss_set_async_flag
00064 
00065   Purpose: Sets the ss_in_async_routine_flag according to the flag
00066      value. This is necessary when semaphore operations under
00067      UNIX are called inside an asynchrounous routine (via alarm)
00068      because they then behave different.
00069 
00070   Input:
00071     INT  flag               May be 1 or 0
00072 
00073   Output:
00074     none
00075 
00076   Function value:
00077     INT                     Previous value of the flag
00078 
00079 \********************************************************************/
00080 {
00081    INT old_flag;
00082 
00083    old_flag = ss_in_async_routine_flag;
00084    ss_in_async_routine_flag = flag;
00085    return old_flag;
00086 }

00112 static void check_shm_type(const char* shm_type)
00113 {
00114 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00115    char file_name[256];
00116    const int file_name_size = sizeof(file_name);
00117    char path[256];
00118    char buf[256];
00119    char* s;
00120    FILE *fp;
00121 
00122    cm_get_path(path);
00123    if (path[0] == 0) {
00124       getcwd(path, 256);
00125       strcat(path, "/");
00126    }
00127 
00128    strlcpy(file_name, path, file_name_size);
00129    strlcat(file_name, ".", file_name_size); /* dot file under UNIX */
00130    strlcat(file_name, "SHM_TYPE", file_name_size);
00131    strlcat(file_name, ".TXT", file_name_size);
00132 
00133    fp = fopen(file_name, "r");
00134    if (!fp) {
00135       fp = fopen(file_name, "w");
00136       if (!fp)
00137          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot write to \'%s\', errno %d (%s)", file_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00138       assert(fp != NULL);
00139       fprintf(fp, "%s\n", shm_type);
00140       fclose(fp);
00141 
00142       fp = fopen(file_name, "r");
00143       if (!fp) {
00144          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot open \'%s\', errno %d (%s)", file_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00145          return;
00146       }
00147    }
00148 
00149    fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), fp);
00150    fclose(fp);
00151 
00152    s = strchr(buf, '\n');
00153    if (s)
00154       *s = 0;
00155 
00156    //printf("shm_type [%s]\n", buf);
00157 
00158    if (strcmp(buf, "SYSV_SHM") == 0) {
00159       use_sysv_shm = 1;
00160       return;
00161    }
00162 
00163    if (strcmp(buf, "MMAP_SHM") == 0) {
00164       use_mmap_shm = 1;
00165       return;
00166    }
00167 
00168    if (strcmp(buf, "POSIX_SHM") == 0) {
00169       use_posix1_shm = 1;
00170       use_posix_shm = 1;
00171       return;
00172    }
00173 
00174    if (strcmp(buf, "POSIXv2_SHM") == 0) {
00175       use_posix2_shm = 1;
00176       use_posix_shm = 1;
00177       return;
00178    }
00179 
00180 #if 0
00181    if (strcmp(buf, shm_type) == 0)
00182       return; // success!
00183 #endif
00184 
00185    cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Error: This MIDAS is built for %s while this experiment uses %s (see \'%s\')", shm_type, buf, file_name);
00186    exit(1);
00187 #endif
00188 }
00189 
00190 static void check_shm_host()
00191 {
00192    char file_name[256];
00193    const int file_name_size = sizeof(file_name);
00194    char path[256];
00195    char buf[256];
00196    char hostname[256];
00197    char* s;
00198    FILE *fp;
00199 
00200    gethostname(hostname, sizeof(hostname));
00201 
00202    //printf("hostname [%s]\n", hostname);
00203 
00204    cm_get_path1(path, sizeof(path));
00205    if (path[0] == 0) {
00206       getcwd(path, 256);
00207 #if defined(OS_VMS)
00208 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
00209       strcat(path, "/");
00210 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
00211       strcat(path, "\\");
00212 #endif
00213    }
00214 
00215    strlcpy(file_name, path, file_name_size);
00216 #if defined (OS_UNIX)
00217    strlcat(file_name, ".", file_name_size); /* dot file under UNIX */
00218 #endif
00219    strlcat(file_name, "SHM_HOST", file_name_size);
00220    strlcat(file_name, ".TXT", file_name_size);
00221 
00222    fp = fopen(file_name, "r");
00223    if (!fp) {
00224       fp = fopen(file_name, "w");
00225       if (!fp)
00226          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot write to \'%s\', errno %d (%s)", file_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00227       assert(fp != NULL);
00228       fprintf(fp, "%s\n", hostname);
00229       fclose(fp);
00230       return;
00231    }
00232 
00233    buf[0] = 0;
00234 
00235    fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), fp);
00236    fclose(fp);
00237 
00238    s = strchr(buf, '\n');
00239    if (s)
00240       *s = 0;
00241 
00242    if (strlen(buf) < 1)
00243       return; // success - provide user with a way to defeat this check
00244 
00245    if (strcmp(buf, hostname) == 0)
00246       return; // success!
00247 
00248    cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Error: Cannot connect to MIDAS shared memory - this computer hostname is \'%s\' while \'%s\' says that MIDAS shared memory for this experiment is located on computer \'%s\'. To connect to this experiment from this computer, use the mserver. Please see the MIDAS documentation for details.", hostname, file_name, buf);
00249    exit(1);
00250 }
00251 
00252 static int ss_shm_name(const char* name, char* mem_name, int mem_name_size, char* file_name, int file_name_size, char* shm_name, int shm_name_size)
00253 {
00254    char exptname[256];
00255    char path[256];
00256 
00257    check_shm_host();
00258 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00259    check_shm_type("POSIXv2_SHM"); // find type of shared memory in use
00260 #endif
00261 
00262    if (mem_name) {
00263       /*
00264          append a leading SM_ to the memory name to resolve name conflicts
00265          with mutex or semaphore names
00266        */
00267       strlcpy(mem_name, "SM_", mem_name_size);
00268       strlcat(mem_name, name, mem_name_size);
00269    }
00270 
00271    /* append .SHM and preceed the path for the shared memory file name */
00272 
00273    cm_get_experiment_name(exptname, sizeof(exptname));
00274    cm_get_path1(path, sizeof(path));
00275 
00276    //printf("shm name [%s], expt name [%s], path [%s]\n", name, exptname, path);
00277 
00278    assert(strlen(path) > 0);
00279    assert(strlen(exptname) > 0);
00280 
00281    if (path[0] == 0) {
00282       getcwd(path, 256);
00283 #if defined(OS_VMS)
00284 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
00285       strcat(path, "/");
00286 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
00287       strcat(path, "\\");
00288 #endif
00289    }
00290 
00291    strlcpy(file_name, path, file_name_size);
00292 #if defined (OS_UNIX)
00293    strlcat(file_name, ".", file_name_size); /* dot file under UNIX */
00294 #endif
00295    strlcat(file_name, name, file_name_size);
00296    strlcat(file_name, ".SHM", file_name_size);
00297 
00298    if (shm_name) {
00299 
00300 #if defined(OS_UNIX)
00301       strlcpy(shm_name, "/", shm_name_size);
00302       if (use_posix1_shm)
00303          strlcat(shm_name, file_name, shm_name_size);
00304       else {
00305          strlcat(shm_name, exptname, shm_name_size);
00306          strlcat(shm_name, "_", shm_name_size);
00307          strlcat(shm_name, name, shm_name_size);
00308          strlcat(shm_name, "_SHM", shm_name_size);
00309       }
00310 
00311       char* s;
00312       for (s=shm_name+1; *s; s++)
00313          if (*s == '/')
00314             *s = '_';
00315 
00316 #ifdef PSHMNAMLEN
00317       if (strlen(shm_name) >= PSHMNAMLEN)
00318          strlcpy(shm_name, name, shm_name_size);
00319 #endif
00320 
00321       //printf("shm_name [%s]\n", shm_name);
00322 
00323 #endif
00324    }
00325 
00326    return SS_SUCCESS;
00327 }
00328 
00329 #if defined OS_UNIX
00330 static int ss_shm_file_name_to_shmid(const char* file_name, int* shmid)
00331 {
00332    int key, status;
00333 
00334    /* create a unique key from the file name */
00335    key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
00336 
00337    /* if file doesn't exist ... */
00338    if (key == -1)
00339       return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00340 
00341    status = shmget(key, 0, 0);
00342    if (status == -1)
00343       return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00344 
00345    (*shmid) = status;
00346    return SS_SUCCESS;
00347 }
00348 #endif

00350 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00351 INT ss_shm_open(const char *name, INT size, void **adr, HNDLE * handle, BOOL get_size)
00352 /********************************************************************\
00353 
00354   Routine: ss_shm_open
00355 
00356   Purpose: Create a shared memory region which can be seen by several
00357      processes which know the name.
00358 
00359   Input:
00360     char *name              Name of the shared memory
00361     INT  size               Initial size of the shared memory in bytes
00362                             if .SHM file doesn't exist
00363     BOOL get_size           If TRUE and shared memory already exists, overwrite
00364                             "size" parameter with existing memory size
00365 
00366   Output:
00367     void  *adr              Address of opened shared memory
00368     HNDLE handle            Handle or key to the shared memory
00369 
00370   Function value:
00371     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00372     SS_CREATED              Shared memory was created
00373     SS_FILE_ERROR           Paging file cannot be created
00374     SS_NO_MEMORY            Not enough memory
00375     SS_SIZE_MISMATCH        "size" differs from existing size and
00376                             get_size is FALSE
00377 \********************************************************************/
00378 {
00379    INT status;
00380    char mem_name[256];
00381    char file_name[256];
00382    char shm_name[256];
00383 
00384    ss_shm_name(name, mem_name, sizeof(mem_name), file_name, sizeof(file_name), shm_name, sizeof(shm_name));
00385 
00386 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00387 
00388    status = SS_SUCCESS;
00389 
00390    {
00391       HANDLE hFile, hMap;
00392       char str[256], path[256], *p;
00393       DWORD file_size;
00394 
00395       /* make the memory name unique using the pathname. This is necessary
00396          because NT doesn't use ftok. So if different experiments are
00397          running in different directories, they should not see the same
00398          shared memory */
00399       cm_get_path(path);
00400       strcpy(str, path);
00401 
00402       /* replace special chars by '*' */
00403       while (strpbrk(str, "\\: "))
00404          *strpbrk(str, "\\: ") = '*';
00405       strcat(str, mem_name);
00406 
00407       /* convert to uppercase */
00408       p = str;
00409       while (*p)
00410          *p++ = (char) toupper(*p);
00411 
00412       hMap = OpenFileMapping(FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, FALSE, str);
00413       if (hMap == 0) {
00414          hFile = CreateFile(file_name, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE,
00415                             FILE_SHARE_READ | FILE_SHARE_WRITE, NULL, OPEN_ALWAYS, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, 0);
00416          if (!hFile) {
00417             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "CreateFile() failed");
00418             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00419          }
00420 
00421          file_size = GetFileSize(hFile, NULL);
00422          if (get_size) {
00423             if (file_size != 0xFFFFFFFF && file_size > 0)
00424                size = file_size;
00425          } else {
00426             if (file_size != 0xFFFFFFFF && file_size > 0 && file_size != size) {
00427                cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Requested size (%d) differs from existing size (%d)", size, file_size);
00428                return SS_SIZE_MISMATCH;
00429             }
00430          }
00431 
00432          hMap = CreateFileMapping(hFile, NULL, PAGE_READWRITE, 0, size, str);
00433 
00434          if (!hMap) {
00435             status = GetLastError();
00436             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "CreateFileMapping() failed, error %d", status);
00437             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00438          }
00439 
00440          CloseHandle(hFile);
00441          status = SS_CREATED;
00442       }
00443 
00444       *adr = MapViewOfFile(hMap, FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, 0, 0, 0);
00445       *handle = (HNDLE) hMap;
00446 
00447       if (adr == NULL) {
00448          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "MapViewOfFile() failed");
00449          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00450       }
00451 
00452       return status;
00453    }
00454 
00455 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00456 #ifdef OS_VMS
00457 
00458    status = SS_SUCCESS;
00459 
00460    {
00461       int addr[2];
00462       $DESCRIPTOR(memname_dsc, "dummy");
00463       $DESCRIPTOR(filename_dsc, "dummy");
00464       memname_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(mem_name);
00465       memname_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = mem_name;
00466       filename_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(file_name);
00467       filename_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = file_name;
00468 
00469       addr[0] = size;
00470       addr[1] = 0;
00471 
00472       status = ppl$create_shared_memory(&memname_dsc, addr, &PPL$M_NOUNI, &filename_dsc);
00473 
00474       if (status == PPL$_CREATED)
00475          status = SS_CREATED;
00476       else if (status != PPL$_NORMAL)
00477          status = SS_FILE_ERROR;
00478 
00479       *adr = (void *) addr[1];
00480       *handle = 0;              /* not used under VMS */
00481 
00482       if (adr == NULL)
00483          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00484 
00485       return status;
00486    }
00487 
00488 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00489 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00490 
00491    if (use_sysv_shm) {
00492       
00493       int key, shmid, fh, file_size;
00494       struct shmid_ds buf;
00495       
00496       status = SS_SUCCESS;
00497       
00498       /* create a unique key from the file name */
00499       key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
00500       
00501       /* if file doesn't exist, create it */
00502       if (key == -1) {
00503          fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_BINARY | O_RDWR, 0644);
00504          if (fh > 0) {
00505             ftruncate(fh, size);
00506             close(fh);
00507          }
00508          key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
00509          
00510          if (key == -1) {
00511             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "ftok() failed");
00512             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00513          }
00514          
00515          status = SS_CREATED;
00516          
00517          /* delete any previously created memory */
00518          
00519          shmid = shmget(key, 0, 0);
00520          shmctl(shmid, IPC_RMID, &buf);
00521       } else {
00522          /* if file exists, retrieve its size */
00523          file_size = (INT) ss_file_size(file_name);
00524          if (get_size) {
00525             size = file_size;
00526          } else if (size != file_size) {
00527             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Existing file \'%s\' has size %d, different from requested size %d",
00528                    file_name, file_size, size);
00529             return SS_SIZE_MISMATCH;
00530          }
00531       }
00532       
00533       /* get the shared memory, create if not existing */
00534       shmid = shmget(key, size, 0);
00535       if (shmid == -1) {
00536          //cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_shm_open", "Creating shared memory segment, key: 0x%x, size: %d",key,size);
00537          shmid = shmget(key, size, IPC_CREAT | IPC_EXCL);
00538          if (shmid == -1 && errno == EEXIST) {
00539             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open",
00540                    "Shared memory segment with key 0x%x already exists, please remove it manually: ipcrm -M 0x%x",
00541                    key, key);
00542             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00543          }
00544          status = SS_CREATED;
00545       }
00546       
00547       if (shmid == -1) {
00548          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "shmget(key=0x%x,size=%d) failed, errno %d (%s)",
00549                 key, size, errno, strerror(errno));
00550          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00551       }
00552       
00553       memset(&buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
00554       buf.shm_perm.uid = getuid();
00555       buf.shm_perm.gid = getgid();
00556       buf.shm_perm.mode = 0666;
00557       shmctl(shmid, IPC_SET, &buf);
00558       
00559       *adr = shmat(shmid, 0, 0);
00560       *handle = (HNDLE) shmid;
00561       
00562       if ((*adr) == (void *) (-1)) {
00563          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "shmat(shmid=%d) failed, errno %d (%s)", shmid, errno, strerror(errno));
00564          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00565       }
00566       
00567       /* if shared memory was created, try to load it from file */
00568       if (status == SS_CREATED) {
00569          fh = open(file_name, O_RDONLY, 0644);
00570          if (fh == -1)
00571             fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_RDWR, 0644);
00572          else
00573             read(fh, *adr, size);
00574          close(fh);
00575       }
00576       
00577       return status;
00578    }
00579    
00580    if (use_mmap_shm) {
00581       
00582       int ret;
00583       int fh, file_size;
00584       int i;
00585       
00586       if (1) {
00587          static int once = 1;
00588          if (once && strstr(file_name, "ODB")) {
00589             once = 0;
00590             cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_shm_open",
00591                    "WARNING: This version of MIDAS system.c uses the experimental mmap() based implementation of MIDAS shared memory.");
00592          }
00593       }
00594       
00595       status = SS_SUCCESS;
00596       
00597       fh = open(file_name, O_RDWR | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644);
00598       
00599       if (fh < 0) {
00600          if (errno == ENOENT) { // file does not exist
00601             fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644);
00602          }
00603          
00604          if (fh < 0) {
00605             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open",
00606                    "Cannot create shared memory file \'%s\', errno %d (%s)", file_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00607             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00608          }
00609          
00610          ret = lseek(fh, size - 1, SEEK_SET);
00611          
00612          if (ret == (off_t) - 1) {
00613             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open",
00614                    "Cannot create shared memory file \'%s\', size %d, lseek() errno %d (%s)",
00615                    file_name, size, errno, strerror(errno));
00616             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00617          }
00618          
00619          ret = 0;
00620          ret = write(fh, &ret, 1);
00621          assert(ret == 1);
00622          
00623          ret = lseek(fh, 0, SEEK_SET);
00624          assert(ret == 0);
00625          
00626          //cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_shm_open", "Created shared memory file \'%s\', size %d", file_name, size);
00627          
00628          status = SS_CREATED;
00629       }
00630       
00631       /* if file exists, retrieve its size */
00632       file_size = (INT) ss_file_size(file_name);
00633       if (file_size < size) {
00634          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open",
00635                 "Shared memory file \'%s\' size %d is smaller than requested size %d. Please remove it and try again",
00636                 file_name, file_size, size);
00637          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00638       }
00639       
00640       size = file_size;
00641       
00642       *adr = mmap(NULL, size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_SHARED, fh, 0);
00643       
00644       if ((*adr) == MAP_FAILED) {
00645          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "mmap() failed, errno %d (%s)", errno, strerror(errno));
00646          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00647       }
00648       
00649       *handle = -1;
00650       for (i = 0; i < MAX_MMAP; i++)
00651          if (mmap_addr[i] == NULL) {
00652             mmap_addr[i] = *adr;
00653             mmap_size[i] = size;
00654             *handle = i;
00655             break;
00656          }
00657       assert((*handle) >= 0);
00658       
00659       return status;
00660    }
00661    
00662    if (use_posix_shm) {
00663       
00664       int fh, sh, file_size;
00665       int created = 0;
00666       int i;
00667       
00668       status = SS_SUCCESS;
00669       
00670       fh = open(file_name, O_RDWR | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644);
00671       
00672       if (fh < 0) {
00673          // if cannot open file, try to create it
00674          fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_BINARY | O_LARGEFILE, 0644);
00675          
00676          if (fh < 0) {
00677             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot create shared memory file \'%s\', errno %d (%s)", file_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00678             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00679          }
00680          
00681          status = ftruncate(fh, size);
00682          if (status < 0) {
00683             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot resize shared memory file \'%s\', size %d, errno %d (%s)", file_name, size, errno, strerror(errno));
00684             close(fh);
00685             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00686          }
00687          
00688          //cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_shm_open", "Created shared memory file \'%s\', size %d", file_name, size);
00689          
00690          /* delete shared memory segment containing now stale data */
00691          ss_shm_delete(name);
00692          
00693          status = SS_CREATED;
00694       }
00695       
00696       /* if file exists, retrieve its size */
00697       file_size = (INT) ss_file_size(file_name);
00698       if (file_size < size) {
00699          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Shared memory file \'%s\' size %d is smaller than requested size %d. Please backup and remove this file and try again", file_name, file_size, size);
00700          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00701       }
00702       
00703       size = file_size;
00704 
00705       sh = shm_open(shm_name, O_RDWR, 0777);
00706       
00707       if (sh < 0) {
00708          // cannot open, try to create new one
00709          
00710          sh = shm_open(shm_name, O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0777);
00711          
00712          if (sh < 0) {
00713             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot create shared memory segment \'%s\', shm_open() errno %d (%s)", shm_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00714             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00715          }
00716          
00717          status = ftruncate(sh, size);
00718          if (status < 0) {
00719             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot resize shared memory segment \'%s\', ftruncate(%d) errno %d (%s)", shm_name, size, errno, strerror(errno));
00720             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00721          }
00722          
00723          //cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_shm_open", "Created shared memory segment \'%s\', size %d", shm_name, size);
00724          
00725          created = 1;
00726       }
00727       
00728       *adr = mmap(NULL, size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE, MAP_SHARED, sh, 0);
00729       
00730       if ((*adr) == MAP_FAILED) {
00731          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot mmap() shared memory \'%s\', errno %d (%s)", shm_name, errno, strerror(errno));
00732          close(fh);
00733          close(sh);
00734          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00735       }
00736       
00737       close(sh);
00738       
00739       /* if shared memory was created, try to load it from file */
00740       if (created) {
00741          if (debug)
00742             printf("ss_shm_open(%s), loading contents of %s, size %d\n", name, file_name, size);
00743          
00744          status = read(fh, *adr, size);
00745          if (status != size) {
00746             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Cannot read \'%s\', read() returned %d instead of %d, errno %d (%s)", file_name, status, size, errno, strerror(errno));
00747             close(fh);
00748             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00749          }
00750       }
00751       
00752       close(fh);
00753       
00754       *handle = -1;
00755       for (i = 0; i < MAX_MMAP; i++)
00756          if (mmap_addr[i] == NULL) {
00757             mmap_addr[i] = *adr;
00758             mmap_size[i] = size;
00759             *handle = i;
00760             break;
00761          }
00762       assert((*handle) >= 0);
00763       
00764       if (created)
00765          return SS_CREATED;
00766       else
00767          return SS_SUCCESS;
00768    }
00769 
00770 #endif /* OS_UNIX */
00771 
00772    return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00773 }
00774 
00775 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00776 INT ss_shm_close(const char *name, void *adr, HNDLE handle, INT destroy_flag)
00777 /********************************************************************\
00778 
00779   Routine: ss_shm_close
00780 
00781   Purpose: Close a shared memory region.
00782 
00783   Input:
00784     char *name              Name of the shared memory
00785     void *adr               Base address of shared memory
00786     HNDLE handle            Handle of shared memeory
00787     BOOL destroy            Shared memory has to be destroyd and
00788           flushed to the mapping file.
00789 
00790   Output:
00791     none
00792 
00793   Function value:
00794     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00795     SS_INVALID_ADDRESS      Invalid base address
00796     SS_FILE_ERROR           Cannot write shared memory file
00797     SS_INVALID_HANDLE       Invalid shared memory handle
00798 
00799 \********************************************************************/
00800 {
00801    char mem_name[256], file_name[256], path[256];
00802 
00803    /*
00804       append a leading SM_ to the memory name to resolve name conflicts
00805       with mutex or semaphore names
00806     */
00807    sprintf(mem_name, "SM_%s", name);
00808 
00809    /* append .SHM and preceed the path for the shared memory file name */
00810    cm_get_path(path);
00811    if (path[0] == 0) {
00812       getcwd(path, 256);
00813 #if defined(OS_VMS)
00814 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
00815       strcat(path, "/");
00816 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
00817       strcat(path, "\\");
00818 #endif
00819    }
00820 
00821    strcpy(file_name, path);
00822 #if defined (OS_UNIX)
00823    strcat(file_name, ".");      /* dot file under UNIX */
00824 #endif
00825    strcat(file_name, name);
00826    strcat(file_name, ".SHM");
00827 
00828 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00829 
00830    if (!UnmapViewOfFile(adr))
00831       return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00832 
00833    CloseHandle((HANDLE) handle);
00834 
00835    return SS_SUCCESS;
00836 
00837 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00838 #ifdef OS_VMS
00839 /* outcommented because ppl$delete... makes privilege violation
00840   {
00841   int addr[2], flags, status;
00842   char mem_name[100];
00843   $DESCRIPTOR(memname_dsc, mem_name);
00844 
00845   strcpy(mem_name, "SM_");
00846   strcat(mem_name, name);
00847   memname_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(mem_name);
00848 
00849   flags = PPL$M_FLUSH | PPL$M_NOUNI;
00850 
00851   addr[0] = 0;
00852   addr[1] = adr;
00853 
00854   status = ppl$delete_shared_memory( &memname_dsc, addr, &flags);
00855 
00856   if (status == PPL$_NORMAL)
00857     return SS_SUCCESS;
00858 
00859   return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00860   }
00861 */
00862    return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00863 
00864 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00865 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00866 
00867    if (use_sysv_shm) {
00868 
00869       struct shmid_ds buf;
00870       FILE *fh;
00871       int i;
00872 
00873       i = destroy_flag;         /* avoid compiler warning */
00874 
00875       /* get info about shared memory */
00876       memset(&buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
00877       if (shmctl(handle, IPC_STAT, &buf) < 0) {
00878          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "shmctl(shmid=%d,IPC_STAT) failed, errno %d (%s)",
00879                 handle, errno, strerror(errno));
00880          return SS_INVALID_HANDLE;
00881       }
00882 
00883       /* copy to file and destroy if we are the last one */
00884       if (buf.shm_nattch == 1) {
00885          if (!disable_shm_write) {
00886             fh = fopen(file_name, "w");
00887 
00888             if (fh == NULL) {
00889                cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "Cannot write to file %s, please check protection", file_name);
00890             } else {
00891                /* write shared memory to file */
00892                fwrite(adr, 1, buf.shm_segsz, fh);
00893                fclose(fh);
00894             }
00895          }
00896 
00897          if (shmdt(adr) < 0) {
00898             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "shmdt(shmid=%d) failed, errno %d (%s)", handle, errno, strerror(errno));
00899             return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00900          }
00901 
00902          if (shmctl(handle, IPC_RMID, &buf) < 0) {
00903             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close",
00904                    "shmctl(shmid=%d,IPC_RMID) failed, errno %d (%s)", handle, errno, strerror(errno));
00905             return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00906          }
00907       } else
00908          /* only detach if we are not the last */
00909       if (shmdt(adr) < 0) {
00910          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "shmdt(shmid=%d) failed, errno %d (%s)", handle, errno, strerror(errno));
00911          return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00912       }
00913 
00914       return SS_SUCCESS;
00915    }
00916 
00917    if (use_mmap_shm || use_posix_shm) {
00918       int status;
00919 
00920       if (debug)
00921          printf("ss_shm_close(%s)\n", name);
00922 
00923       assert(handle>=0 && handle<MAX_MMAP);
00924       assert(adr == mmap_addr[handle]);
00925 
00926       if (destroy_flag) {
00927          status = ss_shm_flush(name, mmap_addr[handle], mmap_size[handle], handle);
00928          if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
00929             return status;
00930       }
00931 
00932       status = munmap(mmap_addr[handle], mmap_size[handle]);
00933       if (status != 0) {
00934          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "Cannot unmap shared memory \'%s\', munmap() errno %d (%s)", name, errno, strerror(errno));
00935          return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00936       }
00937 
00938       mmap_addr[handle] = NULL;
00939       mmap_size[handle] = 0;
00940 
00941       return SS_SUCCESS;
00942    }
00943 #endif /* OS_UNIX */
00944 
00945    return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00946 }
00947 
00948 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00949 INT ss_shm_delete(const char *name)
00950 /********************************************************************\
00951 
00952   Routine: ss_shm_delete
00953 
00954   Purpose: Delete shared memory segment from memory.
00955 
00956   Input:
00957     char *name              Name of the shared memory
00958 
00959   Output:
00960     none
00961 
00962   Function value:
00963     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00964     SS_NO_MEMORY            Shared memory segment does not exist
00965 
00966 \********************************************************************/
00967 {
00968    int status;
00969    char file_name[256];
00970    char shm_name[256];
00971 
00972    status = ss_shm_name(name, NULL, 0, file_name, sizeof(file_name), shm_name, sizeof(shm_name));
00973 
00974 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00975    /* no shared memory segments to delete */
00976    return SS_SUCCESS;
00977 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00978 
00979 #ifdef OS_VMS
00980    assert(!"not implemented!");
00981    return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00982 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00983 
00984 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00985 
00986    if (use_sysv_shm) {
00987       int shmid;
00988       struct shmid_ds buf;
00989       
00990       status = ss_shm_file_name_to_shmid(file_name, &shmid);
00991       
00992       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
00993          return status;
00994       
00995       status = shmctl(shmid, IPC_RMID, &buf);
00996       
00997       if (status == -1) {
00998          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_delete", "Cannot delete shared memory \'%s\', shmctl(IPC_RMID) failed, errno %d (%s)", name, errno, strerror(errno));
00999          return SS_FILE_ERROR;
01000       }
01001       
01002       return SS_SUCCESS;
01003    }
01004    
01005    if (use_mmap_shm) {
01006       /* no shared memory segments to delete */
01007       return SS_SUCCESS;
01008    }
01009 
01010    if (use_posix_shm) {
01011 
01012       //printf("ss_shm_delete(%s) shm_name %s\n", name, shm_name);
01013       status = shm_unlink(shm_name);
01014       if (status < 0) {
01015          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_delete", "shm_unlink(%s) errno %d (%s)", shm_name, errno, strerror(errno));
01016          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01017       }
01018 
01019       return SS_SUCCESS;
01020    }
01021 
01022 #endif /* OS_UNIX */
01023 
01024    return SS_FILE_ERROR;
01025 }
01026 
01027 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01028 INT ss_shm_protect(HNDLE handle, void *adr)
01029 /********************************************************************\
01030 
01031   Routine: ss_shm_protect
01032 
01033   Purpose: Protect a shared memory region, disallow read and write
01034            access to it by this process
01035 
01036   Input:
01037     HNDLE handle            Handle of shared memeory
01038     void  *adr              Address of shared memory
01039 
01040   Output:
01041     none
01042 
01043   Function value:
01044     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01045     SS_INVALID_ADDRESS      Invalid base address
01046 
01047 \********************************************************************/
01048 {
01049 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01050 
01051    if (!UnmapViewOfFile(adr))
01052       return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
01053 
01054 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01055 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01056 
01057    if (use_sysv_shm) {
01058 
01059       int i;
01060       i = handle;                  /* avoid compiler warning */
01061       
01062       if (shmdt(adr) < 0) {
01063          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_protect", "shmdt() failed");
01064          return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
01065       }
01066    }
01067 
01068    if (use_mmap_shm || use_posix_shm) {
01069 
01070       int ret;
01071 
01072       assert(handle>=0 && handle<MAX_MMAP);
01073       assert(adr == mmap_addr[handle]);
01074       
01075       ret = mprotect(mmap_addr[handle], mmap_size[handle], PROT_NONE);
01076       if (ret != 0) {
01077          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_protect",
01078                 "Cannot mprotect(): return value %d, errno %d (%s)", ret, errno, strerror(errno));
01079          return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
01080       }
01081    }
01082 
01083 #endif // OS_UNIX
01084 
01085    return SS_SUCCESS;
01086 }
01087 
01088 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01089 INT ss_shm_unprotect(HNDLE handle, void **adr)
01090 /********************************************************************\
01091 
01092   Routine: ss_shm_unprotect
01093 
01094   Purpose: Unprotect a shared memory region so that it can be accessed
01095            by this process
01096 
01097   Input:
01098     HNDLE handle            Handle or key to the shared memory, must
01099                             be obtained with ss_shm_open
01100 
01101   Output:
01102     void  *adr              Address of opened shared memory
01103 
01104   Function value:
01105     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01106     SS_NO_MEMORY            Memory mapping failed
01107 
01108 \********************************************************************/
01109 {
01110 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01111 
01112    *adr = MapViewOfFile((HANDLE) handle, FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, 0, 0, 0);
01113 
01114    if (*adr == NULL) {
01115       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_unprotect", "MapViewOfFile() failed");
01116       return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01117    }
01118 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01119 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01120 
01121    if (use_sysv_shm) {
01122 
01123       *adr = shmat(handle, 0, 0);
01124       
01125       if ((*adr) == (void *) (-1)) {
01126          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_unprotect", "shmat() failed, errno = %d", errno);
01127          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01128       }
01129    }
01130 
01131    if (use_mmap_shm || use_posix_shm) {
01132       int ret;
01133 
01134       assert(adr == mmap_addr[handle]);
01135 
01136       ret = mprotect(mmap_addr[handle], mmap_size[handle], PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE);
01137       if (ret != 0) {
01138          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_unprotect",
01139                 "Cannot mprotect(): return value %d, errno %d (%s)", ret, errno, strerror(errno));
01140          return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
01141       }
01142    }
01143 
01144 #endif // OS_UNIX
01145 
01146    return SS_SUCCESS;
01147 }
01148 
01149 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01150 INT ss_shm_flush(const char *name, const void *adr, INT size, HNDLE handle)
01151 /********************************************************************\
01152 
01153   Routine: ss_shm_flush
01154 
01155   Purpose: Flush a shared memory region to its disk file.
01156 
01157   Input:
01158     char *name              Name of the shared memory
01159     void *adr               Base address of shared memory
01160     INT  size               Size of shared memeory
01161     HNDLE handle            Handle of shared memory
01162 
01163   Output:
01164     none
01165 
01166   Function value:
01167     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01168     SS_INVALID_ADDRESS      Invalid base address
01169 
01170 \********************************************************************/
01171 {
01172    char file_name[256];
01173 
01174    ss_shm_name(name, NULL, 0, file_name, sizeof(file_name), NULL, 0);
01175 
01176 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01177 
01178    if (!FlushViewOfFile(adr, size))
01179       return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
01180 
01181    return SS_SUCCESS;
01182 
01183 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01184 #ifdef OS_VMS
01185 
01186    return SS_SUCCESS;
01187 
01188 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
01189 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01190 
01191    if ((use_sysv_shm || use_posix_shm) && !disable_shm_write) {
01192 
01193       int fd;
01194       int ret;
01195 
01196       if (use_posix_shm) {
01197          if (debug)
01198             printf("ss_shm_flush(%s) size %d\n", file_name, size);
01199          
01200          assert(handle>=0 && handle<MAX_MMAP);
01201          assert(adr == mmap_addr[handle]);
01202          assert(size == mmap_size[handle]);
01203       }
01204 
01205       fd = open(file_name, O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0777);
01206       if (fd < 0) {
01207          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_flush", "Cannot write to file \'%s\', fopen() errno %d (%s)", file_name, errno, strerror(errno));
01208          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01209       }
01210 
01211       /* write shared memory to file */
01212       ret = write(fd, adr, size);
01213       if (ret != size) {
01214          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_flush", "Cannot write to file \'%s\', write() returned %d instead of %d, errno %d (%s)", file_name, ret, size, errno, strerror(errno));
01215          close(fd);
01216          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01217       }
01218 
01219       ret = close(fd);
01220       if (ret < 0) {
01221          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_flush", "Cannot write to file \'%s\', close() errno %d (%s)", file_name, errno, strerror(errno));
01222          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
01223       }
01224 
01225       return SS_SUCCESS;
01226    }
01227 
01228    if (use_mmap_shm) {
01229       int ret = msync((void *)adr, size, MS_ASYNC);
01230       if (ret != 0) {
01231          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_flush", "Cannot msync(): return value %d, errno %d (%s)", ret, errno, strerror(errno));
01232          return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
01233       }
01234       return SS_SUCCESS;
01235    }
01236 
01237 
01238 #endif // OS_UNIX
01239 
01240    return SS_SUCCESS;
01241 }
01242 
01243 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01244 
01245 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01246 struct {
01247    char c;
01248    double d;
01249 } test_align;
01250 
01251 INT ss_get_struct_align()
01252 /********************************************************************\
01253 
01254   Routine: ss_get_struct_align
01255 
01256   Purpose: Returns compiler alignment of structures. In C, structures
01257      can be byte aligned, word or even quadword aligned. This
01258      can usually be set with compiler switches. This routine
01259      tests this alignment during runtime and returns 1 for
01260      byte alignment, 2 for word alignment, 4 for dword alignment
01261      and 8 for quadword alignment.
01262 
01263   Input:
01264     <none>
01265 
01266   Output:
01267     <none>
01268 
01269   Function value:
01270     INT    Structure alignment
01271 
01272 \********************************************************************/
01273 {
01274    return (POINTER_T) (&test_align.d) - (POINTER_T) & test_align.c;
01275 }
01276 
01277 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01278 INT ss_getpid(void)
01279 /********************************************************************\
01280 
01281   Routine: ss_getpid
01282 
01283   Purpose: Return process ID of current process
01284 
01285   Input:
01286     none
01287 
01288   Output:
01289     none
01290 
01291   Function value:
01292     INT              Process ID
01293 
01294 \********************************************************************/
01295 {
01296 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01297 
01298    return (int) GetCurrentProcessId();
01299 
01300 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01301 #ifdef OS_VMS
01302 
01303    return getpid();
01304 
01305 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
01306 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01307 
01308    return getpid();
01309 
01310 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01311 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
01312 
01313    return 0;
01314 
01315 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
01316 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
01317 
01318    return 0;
01319 
01320 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
01321 }
01322 
01323 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01324 
01325 static BOOL _single_thread = FALSE;
01326 
01327 void ss_force_single_thread()
01328 {
01329    _single_thread = TRUE;
01330 }
01331 
01332 INT ss_gettid(void)
01333 /********************************************************************\
01334 
01335   Routine: ss_ggettid
01336 
01337   Purpose: Return thread ID of current thread
01338 
01339   Input:
01340     none
01341 
01342   Output:
01343     none
01344 
01345   Function value:
01346     INT              thread ID
01347 
01348 \********************************************************************/
01349 {
01350    /* if forced to single thread mode, simply return fake TID */
01351    if (_single_thread)
01352       return 1;
01353 
01354 #if defined OS_MSDOS
01355 
01356    return 0;
01357 
01358 #elif defined OS_WINNT
01359 
01360    return (int) GetCurrentThreadId();
01361 
01362 #elif defined OS_VMS
01363 
01364    return ss_getpid();
01365 
01366 #elif defined OS_DARWIN
01367 
01368    return (int)(long int)pthread_self();
01369 
01370 #elif defined OS_CYGWIN
01371 
01372    return pthread_self();
01373 
01374 #elif defined OS_UNIX
01375 
01376    return syscall(SYS_gettid);
01377 
01378 #elif defined OS_VXWORKS
01379 
01380    return ss_getpid();
01381 
01382 #else
01383 #error Do not know how to do ss_gettid()
01384 #endif
01385 }
01386 
01387 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01388 
01389 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01390 void catch_sigchld(int signo)
01391 {
01392    int status;
01393 
01394    status = signo;              /* avoid compiler warning */
01395    wait(&status);
01396    return;
01397 }
01398 #endif
01399 
01400 INT ss_spawnv(INT mode, char *cmdname, char *argv[])
01401 /********************************************************************\
01402 
01403   Routine: ss_spawnv
01404 
01405   Purpose: Spawn a subprocess or detached process
01406 
01407   Input:
01408     INT mode         One of the following modes:
01409            P_WAIT     Wait for the subprocess to compl.
01410            P_NOWAIT   Don't wait for subprocess to compl.
01411            P_DETACH   Create detached process.
01412     char cmdname     Program name to execute
01413     char *argv[]     Optional program arguments
01414 
01415   Output:
01416     none
01417 
01418   Function value:
01419     SS_SUCCESS       Successful completeion
01420     SS_INVALID_NAME  Command could not be executed;
01421 
01422 \********************************************************************/
01423 {
01424 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01425 
01426    if (spawnvp(mode, cmdname, argv) < 0)
01427       return SS_INVALID_NAME;
01428 
01429    return SS_SUCCESS;
01430 
01431 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01432 
01433 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
01434 
01435    spawnvp((int) mode, cmdname, argv);
01436 
01437    return SS_SUCCESS;
01438 
01439 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
01440 
01441 #ifdef OS_VMS
01442 
01443    {
01444       char cmdstring[500], *pc;
01445       INT i, flags, status;
01446       va_list argptr;
01447 
01448       $DESCRIPTOR(cmdstring_dsc, "dummy");
01449 
01450       if (mode & P_DETACH) {
01451          cmdstring_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(cmdstring);
01452          cmdstring_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = cmdstring;
01453 
01454          status = sys$creprc(0, &cmdstring_dsc, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, NULL, 4, 0, 0, PRC$M_DETACH);
01455       } else {
01456          flags = (mode & P_NOWAIT) ? 1 : 0;
01457 
01458          for (pc = argv[0] + strlen(argv[0]); *pc != ']' && pc != argv[0]; pc--);
01459          if (*pc == ']')
01460             pc++;
01461 
01462          strcpy(cmdstring, pc);
01463 
01464          if (strchr(cmdstring, ';'))
01465             *strchr(cmdstring, ';') = 0;
01466 
01467          strcat(cmdstring, " ");
01468 
01469          for (i = 1; argv[i] != NULL; i++) {
01470             strcat(cmdstring, argv[i]);
01471             strcat(cmdstring, " ");
01472          }
01473 
01474          cmdstring_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(cmdstring);
01475          cmdstring_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = cmdstring;
01476 
01477          status = lib$spawn(&cmdstring_dsc, 0, 0, &flags, NULL, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
01478       }
01479 
01480       return BM_SUCCESS;
01481    }
01482 
01483 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
01484 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01485    pid_t child_pid;
01486 
01487 #ifdef OS_ULTRIX
01488    union wait *status;
01489 #else
01490    int status;
01491 #endif
01492 
01493    if ((child_pid = fork()) < 0)
01494       return (-1);
01495 
01496    if (child_pid == 0) {
01497       /* now we are in the child process ... */
01498       child_pid = execvp(cmdname, argv);
01499       return SS_SUCCESS;
01500    } else {
01501       /* still in parent process */
01502       if (mode == P_WAIT)
01503 #ifdef OS_ULTRIX
01504          waitpid(child_pid, status, WNOHANG);
01505 #else
01506          waitpid(child_pid, &status, WNOHANG);
01507 #endif
01508 
01509       else
01510          /* catch SIGCHLD signal to avoid <defunc> processes */
01511          signal(SIGCHLD, catch_sigchld);
01512    }
01513 
01514    return SS_SUCCESS;
01515 
01516 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01517 }
01518 
01519 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01520 INT ss_shell(int sock)
01521 /********************************************************************\
01522 
01523   Routine: ss_shell
01524 
01525   Purpose: Execute shell via socket (like telnetd)
01526 
01527   Input:
01528     int  sock        Socket
01529 
01530   Output:
01531     none
01532 
01533   Function value:
01534     SS_SUCCESS       Successful completeion
01535 
01536 \********************************************************************/
01537 {
01538 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01539 
01540    HANDLE hChildStdinRd, hChildStdinWr, hChildStdinWrDup,
01541        hChildStdoutRd, hChildStdoutWr, hChildStderrRd, hChildStderrWr, hSaveStdin, hSaveStdout, hSaveStderr;
01542 
01543    SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES saAttr;
01544    PROCESS_INFORMATION piProcInfo;
01545    STARTUPINFO siStartInfo;
01546    char buffer[256], cmd[256];
01547    DWORD dwRead, dwWritten, dwAvail, i, i_cmd;
01548    fd_set readfds;
01549    struct timeval timeout;
01550 
01551    /* Set the bInheritHandle flag so pipe handles are inherited. */
01552    saAttr.nLength = sizeof(SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES);
01553    saAttr.bInheritHandle = TRUE;
01554    saAttr.lpSecurityDescriptor = NULL;
01555 
01556    /* Save the handle to the current STDOUT. */
01557    hSaveStdout = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
01558 
01559    /* Create a pipe for the child's STDOUT. */
01560    if (!CreatePipe(&hChildStdoutRd, &hChildStdoutWr, &saAttr, 0))
01561       return 0;
01562 
01563    /* Set a write handle to the pipe to be STDOUT. */
01564    if (!SetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE, hChildStdoutWr))
01565       return 0;
01566 
01567 
01568    /* Save the handle to the current STDERR. */
01569    hSaveStderr = GetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE);
01570 
01571    /* Create a pipe for the child's STDERR. */
01572    if (!CreatePipe(&hChildStderrRd, &hChildStderrWr, &saAttr, 0))
01573       return 0;
01574 
01575    /* Set a read handle to the pipe to be STDERR. */
01576    if (!SetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE, hChildStderrWr))
01577       return 0;
01578 
01579 
01580    /* Save the handle to the current STDIN. */
01581    hSaveStdin = GetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
01582 
01583    /* Create a pipe for the child's STDIN. */
01584    if (!CreatePipe(&hChildStdinRd, &hChildStdinWr, &saAttr, 0))
01585       return 0;
01586 
01587    /* Set a read handle to the pipe to be STDIN. */
01588    if (!SetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE, hChildStdinRd))
01589       return 0;
01590 
01591    /* Duplicate the write handle to the pipe so it is not inherited. */
01592    if (!DuplicateHandle(GetCurrentProcess(), hChildStdinWr, GetCurrentProcess(), &hChildStdinWrDup, 0, FALSE,   /* not inherited */
01593                         DUPLICATE_SAME_ACCESS))
01594       return 0;
01595 
01596    CloseHandle(hChildStdinWr);
01597 
01598    /* Now create the child process. */
01599    memset(&siStartInfo, 0, sizeof(siStartInfo));
01600    siStartInfo.cb = sizeof(STARTUPINFO);
01601    siStartInfo.lpReserved = NULL;
01602    siStartInfo.lpReserved2 = NULL;
01603    siStartInfo.cbReserved2 = 0;
01604    siStartInfo.lpDesktop = NULL;
01605    siStartInfo.dwFlags = 0;
01606 
01607    if (!CreateProcess(NULL, "cmd /Q",   /* command line */
01608                       NULL,     /* process security attributes */
01609                       NULL,     /* primary thread security attributes */
01610                       TRUE,     /* handles are inherited */
01611                       0,        /* creation flags */
01612                       NULL,     /* use parent's environment */
01613                       NULL,     /* use parent's current directory */
01614                       &siStartInfo,     /* STARTUPINFO pointer */
01615                       &piProcInfo))     /* receives PROCESS_INFORMATION */
01616       return 0;
01617 
01618    /* After process creation, restore the saved STDIN and STDOUT. */
01619    SetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE, hSaveStdin);
01620    SetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE, hSaveStdout);
01621    SetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE, hSaveStderr);
01622 
01623    i_cmd = 0;
01624 
01625    do {
01626       /* query stderr */
01627       do {
01628          if (!PeekNamedPipe(hChildStderrRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, &dwAvail, NULL))
01629             break;
01630 
01631          if (dwRead > 0) {
01632             ReadFile(hChildStderrRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, NULL);
01633             send(sock, buffer, dwRead, 0);
01634          }
01635       } while (dwAvail > 0);
01636 
01637       /* query stdout */
01638       do {
01639          if (!PeekNamedPipe(hChildStdoutRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, &dwAvail, NULL))
01640             break;
01641          if (dwRead > 0) {
01642             ReadFile(hChildStdoutRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, NULL);
01643             send(sock, buffer, dwRead, 0);
01644          }
01645       } while (dwAvail > 0);
01646 
01647 
01648       /* check if subprocess still alive */
01649       if (!GetExitCodeProcess(piProcInfo.hProcess, &i))
01650          break;
01651       if (i != STILL_ACTIVE)
01652          break;
01653 
01654       /* query network socket */
01655       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
01656       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
01657       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
01658       timeout.tv_usec = 100;
01659       select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
01660 
01661       if (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
01662          i = recv(sock, cmd + i_cmd, 1, 0);
01663          if (i <= 0)
01664             break;
01665 
01666          /* backspace */
01667          if (cmd[i_cmd] == 8) {
01668             if (i_cmd > 0) {
01669                send(sock, "\b \b", 3, 0);
01670                i_cmd -= 1;
01671             }
01672          } else if (cmd[i_cmd] >= ' ' || cmd[i_cmd] == 13 || cmd[i_cmd] == 10) {
01673             send(sock, cmd + i_cmd, 1, 0);
01674             i_cmd += i;
01675          }
01676       }
01677 
01678       /* linefeed triggers new command */
01679       if (cmd[i_cmd - 1] == 10) {
01680          WriteFile(hChildStdinWrDup, cmd, i_cmd, &dwWritten, NULL);
01681          i_cmd = 0;
01682       }
01683 
01684    } while (TRUE);
01685 
01686    CloseHandle(hChildStdinWrDup);
01687    CloseHandle(hChildStdinRd);
01688    CloseHandle(hChildStderrRd);
01689    CloseHandle(hChildStdoutRd);
01690 
01691    return SS_SUCCESS;
01692 
01693 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01694 
01695 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01696 #ifndef NO_PTY
01697    pid_t pid;
01698    int i, p;
01699    char line[32], buffer[1024], shell[32];
01700    fd_set readfds;
01701 
01702    if ((pid = forkpty(&p, line, NULL, NULL)) < 0)
01703       return 0;
01704    else if (pid > 0) {
01705       /* parent process */
01706 
01707       do {
01708          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
01709          FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
01710          FD_SET(p, &readfds);
01711 
01712          select(FD_SETSIZE, (void *) &readfds, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01713 
01714          if (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
01715             memset(buffer, 0, sizeof(buffer));
01716             i = recv(sock, buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0);
01717             if (i <= 0)
01718                break;
01719             if (write(p, buffer, i) != i)
01720                break;
01721          }
01722 
01723          if (FD_ISSET(p, &readfds)) {
01724             memset(buffer, 0, sizeof(buffer));
01725             i = read(p, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
01726             if (i <= 0)
01727                break;
01728             send(sock, buffer, i, 0);
01729          }
01730 
01731       } while (1);
01732    } else {
01733       /* child process */
01734 
01735       if (getenv("SHELL"))
01736          strlcpy(shell, getenv("SHELL"), sizeof(shell));
01737       else
01738          strcpy(shell, "/bin/sh");
01739       execl(shell, shell, NULL);
01740    }
01741 #else
01742    send(sock, "not implemented\n", 17, 0);
01743 #endif                          /* NO_PTY */
01744 
01745    return SS_SUCCESS;
01746 
01747 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01748 }
01749 
01750 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01751 static BOOL _daemon_flag;
01752 
01753 INT ss_daemon_init(BOOL keep_stdout)
01754 /********************************************************************\
01755 
01756   Routine: ss_daemon_init
01757 
01758   Purpose: Become a daemon
01759 
01760   Input:
01761     none
01762 
01763   Output:
01764     none
01765 
01766   Function value:
01767     SS_SUCCESS       Successful completeion
01768     SS_ABORT         fork() was not successful, or other problem
01769 
01770 \********************************************************************/
01771 {
01772 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01773 
01774    /* only implemented for UNIX */
01775    int i, fd, pid;
01776 
01777    if ((pid = fork()) < 0)
01778       return SS_ABORT;
01779    else if (pid != 0)
01780       exit(0);                  /* parent finished */
01781 
01782    /* child continues here */
01783 
01784    _daemon_flag = TRUE;
01785 
01786    /* try and use up stdin, stdout and stderr, so other
01787       routines writing to stdout etc won't cause havoc. Copied from smbd */
01788    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
01789       if (keep_stdout && ((i == 1) || (i == 2)))
01790          continue;
01791 
01792       close(i);
01793       fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0);
01794       if (fd < 0)
01795          fd = open("/dev/null", O_WRONLY, 0);
01796       if (fd < 0) {
01797          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_daemon_init", "Can't open /dev/null");
01798          return SS_ABORT;
01799       }
01800       if (fd != i) {
01801          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_daemon_init", "Did not get file descriptor");
01802          return SS_ABORT;
01803       }
01804    }
01805 
01806    setsid();                    /* become session leader */
01807    umask(0);                    /* clear our file mode createion mask */
01808 
01809 #endif
01810 
01811    return SS_SUCCESS;
01812 }
01813 
01814 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01815 BOOL ss_existpid(INT pid)
01816 /********************************************************************\
01817 
01818   Routine: ss_existpid
01819 
01820   Purpose: Execute a Kill sig=0 which return success if pid found.
01821 
01822   Input:
01823     pid  : pid to check
01824 
01825   Output:
01826     none
01827 
01828   Function value:
01829     TRUE      PID found
01830     FALSE     PID not found
01831 
01832 \********************************************************************/
01833 {
01834 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01835    /* only implemented for UNIX */
01836    return (kill(pid, 0) == 0 ? TRUE : FALSE);
01837 #else
01838    cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_existpid", "implemented for UNIX only");
01839    return FALSE;
01840 #endif
01841 }
01842 
01843 
01844 /**dox***************************************************************/
01845 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01846 
01847 /********************************************************************/
01848 /**
01849 Execute command in a separate process, close all open file descriptors
01850 invoke ss_exec() and ignore pid.
01851 \code
01852 { ...
01853   char cmd[256];
01854   sprintf(cmd,"%s %s %i %s/%s %1.3lf %d",lazy.commandAfter,
01855      lazy.backlabel, lazyst.nfiles, lazy.path, lazyst.backfile,
01856      lazyst.file_size/1024.0/1024.0, blockn);
01857   cm_msg(MINFO,"Lazy","Exec post file write script:%s",cmd);
01858   ss_system(cmd);
01859 }
01860 ...
01861 \endcode
01862 @param command Command to execute.
01863 @return SS_SUCCESS or ss_exec() return code
01864 */
01865 INT ss_system(char *command)
01866 {
01867 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01868    INT childpid;
01869 
01870    return ss_exec(command, &childpid);
01871 
01872 #else
01873 
01874    system(command);
01875    return SS_SUCCESS;
01876 
01877 #endif
01878 }
01879 
01880 /**dox***************************************************************/
01881 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
01882 
01883 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01884 INT ss_exec(char *command, INT * pid)
01885 /********************************************************************\
01886 
01887   Routine: ss_exec
01888 
01889   Purpose: Execute command in a separate process, close all open
01890            file descriptors, return the pid of the child process.
01891 
01892   Input:
01893     char * command    Command to execute
01894     INT  * pid        Returned PID of the spawned process.
01895   Output:
01896     none
01897 
01898   Function value:
01899     SS_SUCCESS       Successful completion
01900     SS_ABORT         fork() was not successful, or other problem
01901 
01902 \********************************************************************/
01903 {
01904 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01905 
01906    /* only implemented for UNIX */
01907    int i, fd;
01908 
01909    if ((*pid = fork()) < 0)
01910       return SS_ABORT;
01911    else if (*pid != 0) {
01912       /* avoid <defunc> parent processes */
01913       signal(SIGCHLD, catch_sigchld);
01914       return SS_SUCCESS;        /* parent returns */
01915    }
01916 
01917    /* child continues here... */
01918 
01919    /* close all open file descriptors */
01920    for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
01921       close(i);
01922 
01923    /* try and use up stdin, stdout and stderr, so other
01924       routines writing to stdout etc won't cause havoc */
01925    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
01926       fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0);
01927       if (fd < 0)
01928          fd = open("/dev/null", O_WRONLY, 0);
01929       if (fd < 0) {
01930          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_exec", "Can't open /dev/null");
01931          return SS_ABORT;
01932       }
01933       if (fd != i) {
01934          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_exec", "Did not get file descriptor");
01935          return SS_ABORT;
01936       }
01937    }
01938 
01939    setsid();                    /* become session leader */
01940    /* chdir("/"); *//* change working directory (not on NFS!) */
01941    umask(0);                    /* clear our file mode createion mask */
01942 
01943    /* execute command */
01944    execl("/bin/sh", "sh", "-c", command, NULL);
01945 
01946 #else
01947 
01948    system(command);
01949 
01950 #endif
01951 
01952    return SS_SUCCESS;
01953 }
01954 
01955 /**dox***************************************************************/
01956 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01957 
01958 /********************************************************************/
01959 /**
01960 Creates and returns a new thread of execution. 
01961 
01962 Note the difference when calling from vxWorks versus Linux and Windows.
01963 The parameter pointer for a vxWorks call is a VX_TASK_SPAWN structure, whereas
01964 for Linux and Windows it is a void pointer.
01965 Early versions returned SS_SUCCESS or SS_NO_THREAD instead of thread ID.
01966 
01967 Example for VxWorks
01968 \code
01969 ...
01970 VX_TASK_SPAWN tsWatch = {"Watchdog", 100, 0, 2000,  (int) pDevice, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0 ,0};
01971 midas_thread_t thread_id = ss_thread_create((void *) taskWatch, &tsWatch);
01972 if (thread_id == 0) {
01973   printf("cannot spawn taskWatch\n");
01974 }
01975 ...
01976 \endcode
01977 Example for Linux
01978 \code
01979 ...
01980 midas_thread_t thread_id = ss_thread_create((void *) taskWatch, pDevice);
01981 if (thread_id == 0) {
01982   printf("cannot spawn taskWatch\n");
01983 }
01984 ...
01985 \endcode
01986 @param (*thread_func) Thread function to create.  
01987 @param param a pointer to a VX_TASK_SPAWN structure for vxWorks and a void pointer
01988                 for Unix and Windows
01989 @return the new thread id or zero on error
01990 */
01991 midas_thread_t ss_thread_create(INT(*thread_func) (void *), void *param)
01992 {
01993 #if defined(OS_WINNT)
01994 
01995    HANDLE status;
01996    DWORD thread_id;
01997 
01998    if (thread_func == NULL) {
01999       return 0;
02000    }
02001 
02002    status = CreateThread(NULL, 0, (LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE) thread_func, (LPVOID) param, 0, &thread_id);
02003 
02004    return status == NULL ? 0 : (midas_thread_t) thread_id;
02005 
02006 #elif defined(OS_MSDOS)
02007 
02008    return 0;
02009 
02010 #elif defined(OS_VMS)
02011 
02012    return 0;
02013 
02014 #elif defined(OS_VXWORKS)
02015 
02016 /* taskSpawn which could be considered as a thread under VxWorks
02017    requires several argument beside the thread args
02018    taskSpawn (taskname, priority, option, stacksize, entry_point
02019               , arg1, arg2, ... , arg9, arg10)
02020    all the arg will have to be retrieved from the param list.
02021    through a structure to be simpler  */
02022 
02023    INT status;
02024    VX_TASK_SPAWN *ts;
02025 
02026    ts = (VX_TASK_SPAWN *) param;
02027    status =
02028        taskSpawn(ts->name, ts->priority, ts->options, ts->stackSize,
02029                  (FUNCPTR) thread_func, ts->arg1, ts->arg2, ts->arg3,
02030                  ts->arg4, ts->arg5, ts->arg6, ts->arg7, ts->arg8, ts->arg9, ts->arg10);
02031 
02032    return status == ERROR ? 0 : status;
02033 
02034 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
02035 
02036    INT status;
02037    pthread_t thread_id;
02038 
02039    status = pthread_create(&thread_id, NULL, (void *) thread_func, param);
02040 
02041    return status != 0 ? 0 : thread_id;
02042 
02043 #endif
02044 }
02045 
02046 /********************************************************************/
02047 /** 
02048 Destroys the thread identified by the passed thread id. 
02049 The thread id is returned by ss_thread_create() on creation.
02050 
02051 \code
02052 ...
02053 midas_thread_t thread_id = ss_thread_create((void *) taskWatch, pDevice);
02054 if (thread_id == 0) {
02055   printf("cannot spawn taskWatch\n");
02056 }
02057 ...
02058 ss_thread_kill(thread_id);
02059 ...
02060 \endcode
02061 @param thread_id the thread id of the thread to be killed.
02062 @return SS_SUCCESS if no error, else SS_NO_THREAD
02063 */
02064 INT ss_thread_kill(midas_thread_t thread_id)
02065 {
02066 #if defined(OS_WINNT)
02067 
02068    DWORD status;
02069    HANDLE th;
02070 
02071    th = OpenThread(THREAD_TERMINATE, FALSE, (DWORD)thread_id);
02072    if (th == 0)
02073       status = GetLastError();
02074 
02075    status = TerminateThread(th, 0);
02076 
02077    if (status == 0)
02078       status = GetLastError();
02079 
02080    return status != 0 ? SS_SUCCESS : SS_NO_THREAD;
02081 
02082 #elif defined(OS_MSDOS)
02083 
02084    return 0;
02085 
02086 #elif defined(OS_VMS)
02087 
02088    return 0;
02089 
02090 #elif defined(OS_VXWORKS)
02091 
02092    INT status;
02093    status = taskDelete(thread_id);
02094    return status == OK ? 0 : ERROR;
02095 
02096 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
02097 
02098    INT status;
02099    status = pthread_kill(thread_id, SIGKILL);
02100    return status == 0 ? SS_SUCCESS : SS_NO_THREAD;
02101 
02102 #endif
02103 }
02104 
02105 /**dox***************************************************************/
02106 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02107 
02108 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02109 static INT skip_semaphore_handle = -1;
02110 static int semaphore_trace = 0;
02111 static int semaphore_nest_level = 0;
02112 
02113 INT ss_semaphore_create(const char *name, HNDLE * semaphore_handle)
02114 /********************************************************************\
02115 
02116   Routine: ss_semaphore_create
02117 
02118   Purpose: Create a semaphore with a specific name
02119 
02120     Remark: Under VxWorks the specific semaphore handling is
02121             different than other OS. But VxWorks provides
02122             the POSIX-compatible semaphore interface.
02123             Under POSIX, no timeout is supported.
02124             So for the time being, we keep the pure VxWorks
02125             The semaphore type is a Binary instead of mutex
02126             as the binary is an optimized mutex.
02127 
02128   Input:
02129     char   *name            Name of the semaphore to create.
02130                             Special blank name "" creates a local semaphore for
02131                             syncronization between threads in multithreaded applications.
02132 
02133   Output:
02134     HNDLE  *semaphore_handle    Handle of the created semaphore
02135 
02136   Function value:
02137     SS_CREATED              semaphore was created
02138     SS_SUCCESS              semaphore existed already and was attached
02139     SS_NO_SEMAPHORE         Cannot create semaphore
02140 
02141 \********************************************************************/
02142 {
02143    char semaphore_name[256];
02144 
02145    /* Add a leading MX_ to the semaphore name */
02146    sprintf(semaphore_name, "MX_%s", name);
02147 
02148 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02149 
02150    /* semBCreate is a Binary semaphore which is under VxWorks a optimized mutex
02151       refering to the programmer's Guide 5.3.1 */
02152    if ((*((SEM_ID *) mutex_handle) = semBCreate(SEM_Q_FIFO, SEM_EMPTY)) == NULL)
02153       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02154    return SS_CREATED;
02155 
02156 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02157 
02158 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02159 
02160    *semaphore_handle = (HNDLE) CreateMutex(NULL, FALSE, semaphore_name);
02161 
02162    if (*semaphore_handle == 0)
02163       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02164 
02165    return SS_CREATED;
02166 
02167 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02168 #ifdef OS_VMS
02169 
02170    /* VMS has to use lock manager... */
02171 
02172    {
02173       INT status;
02174       $DESCRIPTOR(semaphorename_dsc, "dummy");
02175       semaphorename_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(semaphore_name);
02176       semaphorename_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = semaphore_name;
02177 
02178       *semaphore_handle = (HNDLE) malloc(8);
02179 
02180       status = sys$enqw(0, LCK$K_NLMODE, *semaphore_handle, 0, &semaphorename_dsc, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
02181 
02182       if (status != SS$_NORMAL) {
02183          free((void *) *semaphore_handle);
02184          *semaphore_handle = 0;
02185       }
02186 
02187       if (*semaphore_handle == 0)
02188          return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02189 
02190       return SS_CREATED;
02191    }
02192 
02193 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02194 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02195 
02196    {
02197       INT key = IPC_PRIVATE;
02198       int status;
02199       struct semid_ds buf;
02200 
02201       if (name[0] != 0) {
02202          int fh;
02203          char path[256], file_name[256];
02204 
02205          /* Build the filename out of the path and the name of the semaphore */
02206          cm_get_path(path);
02207          if (path[0] == 0) {
02208             getcwd(path, 256);
02209             strcat(path, "/");
02210          }
02211 
02212          strcpy(file_name, path);
02213          strcat(file_name, ".");
02214          strcat(file_name, name);
02215          strcat(file_name, ".SHM");
02216 
02217          /* create a unique key from the file name */
02218          key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
02219          if (key < 0) {
02220             fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT, 0644);
02221             close(fh);
02222             key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
02223             status = SS_CREATED;
02224          }
02225       }
02226 
02227 #if (defined(OS_LINUX) && !defined(_SEM_SEMUN_UNDEFINED) && !defined(OS_CYGWIN)) || defined(OS_FREEBSD)
02228       union semun arg;
02229 #else
02230       union semun {
02231          INT val;
02232          struct semid_ds *buf;
02233          ushort *array;
02234       } arg;
02235 #endif
02236 
02237       status = SS_SUCCESS;
02238 
02239       /* create or get semaphore */
02240       *semaphore_handle = (HNDLE) semget(key, 1, 0);
02241       if (*semaphore_handle < 0) {
02242          *semaphore_handle = (HNDLE) semget(key, 1, IPC_CREAT);
02243          status = SS_CREATED;
02244       }
02245 
02246       if (*semaphore_handle < 0) {
02247          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_semaphore_create", "Cannot create semaphore \'%s\', semget(0x%x) failed, errno %d (%s)", name, key, errno, strerror(errno));
02248          return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02249       }
02250 
02251       memset(&buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
02252       buf.sem_perm.uid = getuid();
02253       buf.sem_perm.gid = getgid();
02254       buf.sem_perm.mode = 0666;
02255       arg.buf = &buf;
02256 
02257       semctl(*semaphore_handle, 0, IPC_SET, arg);
02258 
02259       /* if semaphore was created, set value to one */
02260       if (key == IPC_PRIVATE || status == SS_CREATED) {
02261          arg.val = 1;
02262          if (semctl(*semaphore_handle, 0, SETVAL, arg) < 0)
02263             return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02264       }
02265 
02266       if (semaphore_trace) {
02267          fprintf(stderr, "name %d %d %d %s\n", *semaphore_handle, (int)time(NULL), getpid(), name);
02268       }
02269 
02270       return SS_SUCCESS;
02271    }
02272 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02273 
02274 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02275    return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02276 #endif
02277 }
02278 
02279 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02280 INT ss_semaphore_wait_for(HNDLE semaphore_handle, INT timeout)
02281 /********************************************************************\
02282 
02283   Routine: ss_semaphore_wait_for
02284 
02285   Purpose: Wait for a semaphore to get owned
02286 
02287   Input:
02288     HNDLE  *semaphore_handle    Handle of the semaphore
02289     INT    timeout          Timeout in ms, zero for no timeout
02290 
02291   Output:
02292     none
02293 
02294   Function value:
02295     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02296     SS_NO_SEMAPHORE         Invalid semaphore handle
02297     SS_TIMEOUT              Timeout
02298 
02299 \********************************************************************/
02300 {
02301    INT status;
02302 
02303 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02304 
02305    status = WaitForSingleObject((HANDLE) semaphore_handle, timeout == 0 ? INFINITE : timeout);
02306    if (status == WAIT_FAILED)
02307       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02308    if (status == WAIT_TIMEOUT)
02309       return SS_TIMEOUT;
02310 
02311    return SS_SUCCESS;
02312 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02313 #ifdef OS_VMS
02314    status = sys$enqw(0, LCK$K_EXMODE, semaphore_handle, LCK$M_CONVERT, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
02315    if (status != SS$_NORMAL)
02316       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02317    return SS_SUCCESS;
02318 
02319 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02320 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02321    /* convert timeout in ticks (1/60) = 1000/60 ~ 1/16 = >>4 */
02322    status = semTake((SEM_ID) semaphore_handle, timeout == 0 ? WAIT_FOREVER : timeout >> 4);
02323    if (status == ERROR)
02324       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02325    return SS_SUCCESS;
02326 
02327 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02328 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02329    {
02330       DWORD start_time;
02331       struct sembuf sb;
02332 
02333 #if (defined(OS_LINUX) && !defined(_SEM_SEMUN_UNDEFINED) && !defined(OS_CYGWIN)) || defined(OS_FREEBSD)
02334       union semun arg;
02335 #else
02336       union semun {
02337          INT val;
02338          struct semid_ds *buf;
02339          ushort *array;
02340       } arg;
02341 #endif
02342 
02343       sb.sem_num = 0;
02344       sb.sem_op = -1;           /* decrement semaphore */
02345       sb.sem_flg = SEM_UNDO;
02346 
02347       memset(&arg, 0, sizeof(arg));
02348 
02349       /* don't request the semaphore when in asynchronous state
02350          and semaphore was locked already by foreground process */
02351       if (ss_in_async_routine_flag)
02352          if (semctl(semaphore_handle, 0, GETPID, arg) == getpid())
02353             if (semctl(semaphore_handle, 0, GETVAL, arg) == 0) {
02354                skip_semaphore_handle = semaphore_handle;
02355                if (semaphore_trace)
02356                   fprintf(stderr,"lock skip sema handle %d, my pid %d\n", skip_semaphore_handle, getpid());
02357                return SS_SUCCESS;
02358             }
02359 
02360       skip_semaphore_handle = -1;
02361 
02362       start_time = ss_millitime();
02363 
02364       if (semaphore_trace) {
02365          fprintf(stderr, "waitlock %d %d %d nest %d\n", semaphore_handle, ss_millitime(), getpid(), semaphore_nest_level);
02366       }
02367 
02368       do {
02369 #if defined(OS_DARWIN)
02370          status = semop(semaphore_handle, &sb, 1);
02371 #elif defined(OS_LINUX)
02372          struct timespec ts;
02373          ts.tv_sec  = 1;
02374          ts.tv_nsec = 0;
02375          
02376          status = semtimedop(semaphore_handle, &sb, 1, &ts);
02377 #else
02378          status = semop(semaphore_handle, &sb, 1);
02379 #endif
02380 
02381          /* return on success */
02382          if (status == 0)
02383             break;
02384 
02385          /* retry if interrupted by a ss_wake signal */
02386          if (errno == EINTR || errno == EAGAIN) {
02387             /* return if timeout expired */
02388             if (timeout > 0 && (int) (ss_millitime() - start_time) > timeout)
02389                return SS_TIMEOUT;
02390 
02391             continue;
02392          }
02393 
02394          fprintf(stderr, "ss_semaphore_wait_for: semop/semtimedop(%d) returned %d, errno %d (%s)\n", semaphore_handle, status, errno, strerror(errno));
02395          return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02396       } while (1);
02397 
02398       if (semaphore_trace) {
02399          semaphore_nest_level++;
02400          fprintf(stderr, "lock %d %d %d nest %d\n", semaphore_handle, ss_millitime(), getpid(), semaphore_nest_level);
02401       }
02402 
02403       return SS_SUCCESS;
02404    }
02405 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02406 
02407 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02408    return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02409 #endif
02410 }
02411 
02412 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02413 INT ss_semaphore_release(HNDLE semaphore_handle)
02414 /********************************************************************\
02415 
02416   Routine: ss_semaphore_release
02417 
02418   Purpose: Release ownership of a semaphore
02419 
02420   Input:
02421     HNDLE  *semaphore_handle    Handle of the semaphore
02422 
02423   Output:
02424     none
02425 
02426   Function value:
02427     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02428     SS_NO_SEMAPHORE         Invalid semaphore handle
02429 
02430 \********************************************************************/
02431 {
02432    INT status;
02433 
02434 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02435 
02436    status = ReleaseMutex((HANDLE) semaphore_handle);
02437 
02438    if (status == FALSE)
02439       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02440 
02441    return SS_SUCCESS;
02442 
02443 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02444 #ifdef OS_VMS
02445 
02446    status = sys$enqw(0, LCK$K_NLMODE, semaphore_handle, LCK$M_CONVERT, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
02447 
02448    if (status != SS$_NORMAL)
02449       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02450 
02451    return SS_SUCCESS;
02452 
02453 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02454 
02455 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02456 
02457    if (semGive((SEM_ID) semaphore_handle) == ERROR)
02458       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02459    return SS_SUCCESS;
02460 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02461 
02462 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02463    {
02464       struct sembuf sb;
02465 
02466       sb.sem_num = 0;
02467       sb.sem_op = 1;            /* increment semaphore */
02468       sb.sem_flg = SEM_UNDO;
02469 
02470       if (semaphore_handle == skip_semaphore_handle) {
02471          if (semaphore_trace)
02472             fprintf(stderr,"unlock skip sema handle %d, my pid %d\n", skip_semaphore_handle, getpid());
02473          skip_semaphore_handle = -1;
02474          return SS_SUCCESS;
02475       }
02476 
02477       if (semaphore_trace) {
02478          fprintf(stderr, "unlock %d %d %d nest %d\n", semaphore_handle, ss_millitime(), getpid(), semaphore_nest_level);
02479          assert(semaphore_nest_level > 0);
02480          semaphore_nest_level--;
02481       }
02482 
02483       do {
