02484          status = semop(semaphore_handle, &sb, 1);
02485 
02486          /* return on success */
02487          if (status == 0)
02488             break;
02489 
02490          /* retry if interrupted by a ss_wake signal */
02491          if (errno == EINTR)
02492             continue;
02493 
02494          fprintf(stderr, "ss_semaphore_release: semop/semtimedop(%d) returned %d, errno %d (%s)\n", semaphore_handle, status, errno, strerror(errno));
02495          return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02496       } while (1);
02497 
02498       return SS_SUCCESS;
02499    }
02500 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02501 
02502 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02503    return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02504 #endif
02505 }
02506 
02507 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02508 INT ss_semaphore_delete(HNDLE semaphore_handle, INT destroy_flag)
02509 /********************************************************************\
02510 
02511   Routine: ss_semaphore_delete
02512 
02513   Purpose: Delete a semaphore
02514 
02515   Input:
02516     HNDLE  *semaphore_handle    Handle of the semaphore
02517 
02518   Output:
02519     none
02520 
02521   Function value:
02522     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02523     SS_NO_SEMAPHORE         Invalid semaphore handle
02524 
02525 \********************************************************************/
02526 {
02527 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02528 
02529    if (CloseHandle((HANDLE) semaphore_handle) == FALSE)
02530       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02531 
02532    return SS_SUCCESS;
02533 
02534 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02535 #ifdef OS_VMS
02536 
02537    free((void *) semaphore_handle);
02538    return SS_SUCCESS;
02539 
02540 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02541 
02542 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02543    /* no code for VxWorks destroy yet */
02544    if (semDelete((SEM_ID) semaphore_handle) == ERROR)
02545       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02546    return SS_SUCCESS;
02547 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02548 
02549 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02550 #if (defined(OS_LINUX) && !defined(_SEM_SEMUN_UNDEFINED) && !defined(OS_CYGWIN)) || defined(OS_FREEBSD)
02551    union semun arg;
02552 #else
02553    union semun {
02554       INT val;
02555       struct semid_ds *buf;
02556       ushort *array;
02557    } arg;
02558 #endif
02559 
02560    memset(&arg, 0, sizeof(arg));
02561 
02562    if (destroy_flag)
02563       if (semctl(semaphore_handle, 0, IPC_RMID, arg) < 0)
02564          return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02565 
02566    return SS_SUCCESS;
02567 
02568 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02569 
02570 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02571    return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02572 #endif
02573 }
02574 
02575 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02576 
02577 INT ss_mutex_create(MUTEX_T ** mutex)
02578 /********************************************************************\
02579 
02580   Routine: ss_mutex_create
02581 
02582   Purpose: Create a mutex for inter-thread locking
02583 
02584   Output:
02585     MUTEX_T mutex           Address of pointer to mutex
02586 
02587   Function value:
02588     SS_CREATED              Mutex was created
02589     SS_NO_SEMAPHORE         Cannot create mutex
02590 
02591 \********************************************************************/
02592 {
02593 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02594 
02595    /* semBCreate is a Binary semaphore which is under VxWorks a optimized mutex
02596       refering to the programmer's Guide 5.3.1 */
02597    if ((*((SEM_ID *) mutex_handle) = semBCreate(SEM_Q_FIFO, SEM_EMPTY)) == NULL)
02598       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02599    return SS_CREATED;
02600 
02601 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02602 
02603 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02604 
02605    *mutex = (MUTEX_T *)malloc(sizeof(HANDLE));
02606    **mutex = CreateMutex(NULL, FALSE, NULL);
02607 
02608    if (**mutex == 0)
02609       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02610 
02611    return SS_CREATED;
02612 
02613 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02614 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02615 
02616    {
02617       int status;
02618 
02619       *mutex = malloc(sizeof(pthread_mutex_t));
02620       assert(*mutex);
02621 
02622       status = pthread_mutex_init(*mutex, NULL);
02623       if (status != 0) {
02624          fprintf(stderr, "ss_mutex_create: pthread_mutex_init() returned errno %d (%s), aborting...\n", status, strerror(status));
02625          abort(); // does not return
02626          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02627       }
02628 
02629       return SS_SUCCESS;
02630    }
02631 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02632 
02633 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02634    return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02635 #endif
02636 }
02637 
02638 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02639 INT ss_mutex_wait_for(MUTEX_T *mutex, INT timeout)
02640 /********************************************************************\
02641 
02642   Routine: ss_mutex_wait_for
02643 
02644   Purpose: Wait for a mutex to get owned
02645 
02646   Input:
02647     MUTEX_T  *mutex         Pointer to mutex
02648     INT    timeout          Timeout in ms, zero for no timeout
02649 
02650   Output:
02651     none
02652 
02653   Function value:
02654     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02655     SS_NO_MUTEX             Invalid mutex handle
02656     SS_TIMEOUT              Timeout
02657 
02658 \********************************************************************/
02659 {
02660    INT status;
02661 
02662 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02663 
02664    status = WaitForSingleObject(*mutex, timeout == 0 ? INFINITE : timeout);
02665 
02666    if (status == WAIT_TIMEOUT) {
02667       return SS_TIMEOUT;
02668    }
02669 
02670    if (status == WAIT_FAILED) {
02671       fprintf(stderr, "ss_mutex_wait_for: WaitForSingleObject() failed, status = %d", status);
02672       abort(); // does not return
02673       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02674    }
02675 
02676    return SS_SUCCESS;
02677 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02678 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02679    /* convert timeout in ticks (1/60) = 1000/60 ~ 1/16 = >>4 */
02680    status = semTake((SEM_ID) mutex, timeout == 0 ? WAIT_FOREVER : timeout >> 4);
02681    if (status == ERROR)
02682       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02683    return SS_SUCCESS;
02684 
02685 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02686 #if defined(OS_UNIX)
02687 
02688 #if !defined(OS_DARWIN)
02689    if (timeout > 0) {
02690       extern int pthread_mutex_timedlock (pthread_mutex_t *__restrict __mutex, __const struct timespec *__restrict __abstime) __THROW;
02691       struct timespec st;
02692 
02693       clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &st);
02694       st.tv_sec += timeout / 1000;
02695       st.tv_nsec += (timeout % 1000) * 1E6;
02696       status = pthread_mutex_timedlock(mutex, &st);
02697       if (status == ETIMEDOUT)
02698          return SS_TIMEOUT;
02699       if (status != 0) {
02700          fprintf(stderr, "ss_mutex_wait_for: pthread_mutex_timedlock() returned errno %d (%s), aborting...\n", status, strerror(status));
02701          abort(); // does not return
02702          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02703       }
02704 
02705       return SS_SUCCESS;
02706    }
02707 #endif
02708 
02709    // no timeout or OS_DARWIN
02710 
02711    status = pthread_mutex_lock(mutex);
02712    if (status != 0) {
02713       fprintf(stderr, "ss_mutex_wait_for: pthread_mutex_lock() returned errno %d (%s), aborting...\n", status, strerror(status));
02714       abort(); // does not return
02715       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02716    }
02717 
02718    return SS_SUCCESS;
02719 #endif /* OS_UNIX */
02720 
02721 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02722    return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02723 #endif
02724 }
02725 
02726 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02727 INT ss_mutex_release(MUTEX_T *mutex)
02728 /********************************************************************\
02729 
02730   Routine: ss_mutex_release
02731 
02732   Purpose: Release ownership of a mutex
02733 
02734   Input:
02735     MUTEX_T  *mutex         Pointer to mutex
02736 
02737   Output:
02738     none
02739 
02740   Function value:
02741     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02742     SS_NO_MUTES             Invalid mutes handle
02743 
02744 \********************************************************************/
02745 {
02746    INT status;
02747 
02748 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02749 
02750    status = ReleaseMutex(*mutex);
02751    if (status == FALSE)
02752       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02753 
02754    return SS_SUCCESS;
02755 
02756 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02757 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02758 
02759    if (semGive((SEM_ID) mutes_handle) == ERROR)
02760       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02761    return SS_SUCCESS;
02762 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02763 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02764 
02765       status = pthread_mutex_unlock(mutex);
02766       if (status != 0) {
02767          fprintf(stderr, "ss_mutex_release: pthread_mutex_unlock() returned error %d (%s), aborting...\n", status, strerror(status));
02768          abort(); // does not return
02769          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02770       }
02771 
02772       return SS_SUCCESS;
02773 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02774 
02775 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02776    return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02777 #endif
02778 }
02779 
02780 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02781 INT ss_mutex_delete(MUTEX_T *mutex)
02782 /********************************************************************\
02783 
02784   Routine: ss_mutex_delete
02785 
02786   Purpose: Delete a mutex
02787 
02788   Input:
02789     MUTEX_T  *mutex         Pointer to mutex
02790 
02791   Output:
02792     none
02793 
02794   Function value:
02795     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02796     SS_NO_MUTEX             Invalid mutex handle
02797 
02798 \********************************************************************/
02799 {
02800 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02801 
02802    if (CloseHandle(*mutex) == FALSE)
02803       return SS_NO_SEMAPHORE;
02804 
02805    free(mutex);
02806 
02807    return SS_SUCCESS;
02808 
02809 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02810 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02811    /* no code for VxWorks destroy yet */
02812    if (semDelete((SEM_ID) mutex_handle) == ERROR)
02813       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02814    return SS_SUCCESS;
02815 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02816 
02817 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02818    { 
02819       int status;
02820       
02821       status = pthread_mutex_destroy(mutex);
02822       if (status != 0) {
02823          fprintf(stderr, "ss_mutex_delete: pthread_mutex_destroy() returned errno %d (%s), aborting...\n", status, strerror(status));
02824          abort(); // do not return
02825          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02826       }
02827 
02828       free(mutex);
02829       return SS_SUCCESS;
02830    }
02831 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02832 }
02833 
02834 /**dox***************************************************************/
02835 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02836 
02837 /********************************************************************/
02838 /**
02839 Returns the actual time in milliseconds with an arbitrary
02840 origin. This time may only be used to calculate relative times.
02841 
02842 Overruns in the 32 bit value don't hurt since in a subtraction calculated
02843 with 32 bit accuracy this overrun cancels (you may think about!)..
02844 \code
02845 ...
02846 DWORD start, stop:
02847 start = ss_millitime();
02848   < do operations >
02849 stop = ss_millitime();
02850 printf("Operation took %1.3lf seconds\n",(stop-start)/1000.0);
02851 ...
02852 \endcode
02853 @return millisecond time stamp.
02854 */
02855 DWORD ss_millitime()
02856 {
02857 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02858 
02859    return (int) GetTickCount();
02860 
02861 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02862 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02863 
02864    return clock() * 55;
02865 
02866 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
02867 #ifdef OS_VMS
02868 
02869    {
02870       char time[8];
02871       DWORD lo, hi;
02872 
02873       sys$gettim(time);
02874 
02875       lo = *((DWORD *) time);
02876       hi = *((DWORD *) (time + 4));
02877 
02878 /*  return *lo / 10000; */
02879 
02880       return lo / 10000 + hi * 429496.7296;
02881 
02882    }
02883 
02884 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02885 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02886    {
02887       struct timeval tv;
02888 
02889       gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
02890 
02891       return tv.tv_sec * 1000 + tv.tv_usec / 1000;
02892    }
02893 
02894 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02895 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02896    {
02897       int count;
02898       static int ticks_per_msec = 0;
02899 
02900       if (ticks_per_msec == 0)
02901          ticks_per_msec = 1000 / sysClkRateGet();
02902 
02903       return tickGet() * ticks_per_msec;
02904    }
02905 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02906 }
02907 
02908 /********************************************************************/
02909 /**
02910 Returns the actual time in seconds since 1.1.1970 UTC.
02911 \code
02912 ...
02913 DWORD start, stop:
02914 start = ss_time();
02915   ss_sleep(12000);
02916 stop = ss_time();
02917 printf("Operation took %1.3lf seconds\n",stop-start);
02918 ...
02919 \endcode
02920 @return Time in seconds
02921 */
02922 DWORD ss_time()
02923 {
02924 #if !defined(OS_VXWORKS)
02925 #if !defined(OS_VMS)
02926 #if 0
02927    static int once = 0;
02928    if (once == 0) {
02929       tzset();
02930       once = 1;
02931    }
02932 #endif
02933 #endif
02934 #endif
02935    return (DWORD) time(NULL);
02936 }
02937 
02938 /**dox***************************************************************/
02939 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02940 
02941 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02942 DWORD ss_settime(DWORD seconds)
02943 /********************************************************************\
02944 
02945   Routine: ss_settime
02946 
02947   Purpose: Set local time. Used to synchronize different computers
02948 
02949    Input:
02950     INT    Time in seconds since 1.1.1970 UTC.
02951 
02952   Output:
02953     none
02954 
02955   Function value:
02956 
02957 \********************************************************************/
02958 {
02959 #if defined(OS_WINNT)
02960    SYSTEMTIME st;
02961    struct tm *ltm;
02962 
02963    tzset();
02964    ltm = localtime((time_t *) & seconds);
02965 
02966    st.wYear = ltm->tm_year + 1900;
02967    st.wMonth = ltm->tm_mon + 1;
02968    st.wDay = ltm->tm_mday;
02969    st.wHour = ltm->tm_hour;
02970    st.wMinute = ltm->tm_min;
02971    st.wSecond = ltm->tm_sec;
02972    st.wMilliseconds = 0;
02973 
02974    SetLocalTime(&st);
02975 
02976 #elif defined(OS_DARWIN)
02977 
02978    assert(!"ss_settime() is not supported");
02979    /* not reached */
02980    return SS_NO_DRIVER;
02981 
02982 #elif defined(OS_CYGWIN)
02983 
02984    assert(!"ss_settime() is not supported");
02985    /* not reached */
02986    return SS_NO_DRIVER;
02987 
02988 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
02989 
02990    stime((void *) &seconds);
02991 
02992 #elif defined(OS_VXWORKS)
02993 
02994    struct timespec ltm;
02995 
02996    ltm.tv_sec = seconds;
02997    ltm.tv_nsec = 0;
02998    clock_settime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &ltm);
02999 
03000 #endif
03001    return SS_SUCCESS;
03002 }
03003 
03004 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03005 char *ss_asctime()
03006 /********************************************************************\
03007 
03008   Routine: ss_asctime
03009 
03010   Purpose: Returns the local actual time as a string
03011 
03012   Input:
03013     none
03014 
03015   Output:
03016     none
03017 
03018   Function value:
03019     char   *     Time string
03020 
03021 \********************************************************************/
03022 {
03023    static char str[32];
03024    time_t seconds;
03025 
03026    seconds = (time_t) ss_time();
03027 
03028 #if !defined(OS_VXWORKS)
03029 #if !defined(OS_VMS)
03030    tzset();
03031 #endif
03032 #endif
03033    strcpy(str, asctime(localtime(&seconds)));
03034 
03035    /* strip new line */
03036    str[24] = 0;
03037 
03038    return str;
03039 }

03041 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03042 INT ss_timezone()
03043 /********************************************************************\
03044 
03045   Routine: ss_timezone
03046

03048            time and local time.
03049 
03050   Input:
03051     none
03052 
03053   Output:
03054     none
03055 
03056   Function value:
03057     INT    Time difference in seconds
03058 
03059 \********************************************************************/
03060 {
03061 #if defined(OS_DARWIN) || defined(OS_VXWORKS)
03062    return 0;
03063 #else
03064    return (INT) timezone;       /* on Linux, comes from "#include <time.h>". */
03065 #endif
03066 }

03068 
03069 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03070 
03071 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03072 /* dummy function for signal() call */
03073 void ss_cont()
03074 {
03075 }
03076 #endif
03077 
03078 /**dox***************************************************************/
03079 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
03080 
03081 /********************************************************************/
03082 /**
03083 Suspend the calling process for a certain time.
03084 
03085 The function is similar to the sleep() function,
03086 but has a resolution of one milliseconds. Under VxWorks the resolution
03087 is 1/60 of a second. It uses the socket select() function with a time-out.
03088 See examples in ss_time()
03089 @param millisec Time in milliseconds to sleep. Zero means
03090                 infinite (until another process calls ss_wake)
03091 @return SS_SUCCESS
03092 */
03093 INT ss_sleep(INT millisec)
03094 {
03095    if (millisec == 0) {
03096 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03097       SuspendThread(GetCurrentThread());
03098 #endif
03099 #ifdef OS_VMS
03100       sys$hiber();
03101 #endif
03102 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03103       signal(SIGCONT, ss_cont);
03104       pause();
03105 #endif
03106       return SS_SUCCESS;
03107    }
03108 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03109    Sleep(millisec);
03110 #endif
03111 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03112    struct timespec ts;
03113    int status;
03114 
03115    ts.tv_sec = millisec / 1000;
03116    ts.tv_nsec = (millisec % 1000) * 1E6;
03117 
03118    do {
03119       status = nanosleep(&ts, &ts);
03120       if ((int)ts.tv_sec < 0) 
03121          break; // can be negative under OSX
03122    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
03123 #endif
03124 
03125    return SS_SUCCESS;
03126 }
03127 
03128 /**dox***************************************************************/
03129 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
03130 
03131 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03132 BOOL ss_kbhit()
03133 /********************************************************************\
03134 
03135   Routine: ss_kbhit
03136 
03137   Purpose: Returns TRUE if a key is pressed
03138 
03139   Input:
03140     none
03141 
03142   Output:
03143     none
03144 
03145   Function value:
03146     FALSE                 No key has been pressed
03147     TRUE                  Key has been pressed
03148 
03149 \********************************************************************/
03150 {
03151 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
03152 
03153    return kbhit();
03154 
03155 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
03156 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03157 
03158    return kbhit();
03159 
03160 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
03161 #ifdef OS_VMS
03162 
03163    return FALSE;
03164 
03165 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
03166 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03167 
03168    int n;
03169 
03170    if (_daemon_flag)
03171       return 0;
03172 
03173    ioctl(0, FIONREAD, &n);
03174    return (n > 0);
03175 
03176 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
03177 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
03178 
03179    int n;
03180    ioctl(0, FIONREAD, (long) &n);
03181    return (n > 0);
03182 
03183 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
03184 }

03187 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03188 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03189 
03190 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03191 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03192 
03193 static void (*UserCallback) (int);
03194 static UINT _timer_id = 0;
03195 
03196 VOID CALLBACK _timeCallback(UINT idEvent, UINT uReserved, DWORD dwUser, DWORD dwReserved1, DWORD dwReserved2)
03197 {
03198    _timer_id = 0;
03199    if (UserCallback != NULL)
03200       UserCallback(0);
03201 }
03202 
03203 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
03204 
03205 INT ss_alarm(INT millitime, void (*func) (int))
03206 /********************************************************************\
03207 
03208   Routine: ss_alarm
03209 
03210   Purpose: Schedules an alarm. Call function referenced by *func
03211      after the specified seconds.
03212 
03213   Input:
03214     INT    millitime        Time in milliseconds
03215     void   (*func)()        Function to be called after the spe-
03216           cified time.
03217 
03218   Output:
03219     none
03220 
03221   Function value:
03222     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03223 
03224 \********************************************************************/
03225 {
03226 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03227 
03228    UserCallback = func;
03229    if (millitime > 0)
03230       _timer_id = timeSetEvent(millitime, 100, (LPTIMECALLBACK) _timeCallback, 0, TIME_ONESHOT);
03231    else {
03232       if (_timer_id)
03233          timeKillEvent(_timer_id);
03234       _timer_id = 0;
03235    }
03236 
03237    return SS_SUCCESS;
03238 
03239 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
03240 #ifdef OS_VMS
03241 
03242    signal(SIGALRM, func);
03243    alarm(millitime / 1000);
03244    return SS_SUCCESS;
03245 
03246 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
03247 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03248 
03249    signal(SIGALRM, func);
03250    alarm(millitime / 1000);
03251    return SS_SUCCESS;
03252 
03253 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
03254 }

03256 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03257 void (*MidasExceptionHandler) ();
03258 
03259 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03260 
03261 LONG MidasExceptionFilter(LPEXCEPTION_POINTERS pexcep)
03262 {
03263    if (MidasExceptionHandler != NULL)
03264       MidasExceptionHandler();
03265 
03266    return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
03267 }
03268 
03269 INT MidasExceptionSignal(INT sig)
03270 {
03271    if (MidasExceptionHandler != NULL)
03272       MidasExceptionHandler();
03273 
03274    raise(sig);
03275 
03276    return 0;
03277 }
03278 
03279 /*
03280 INT _matherr(struct _exception *except)
03281 {
03282   if (MidasExceptionHandler != NULL)
03283     MidasExceptionHandler();
03284 
03285   return 0;
03286 }
03287 */
03288 
03289 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
03290 
03291 #ifdef OS_VMS

03293 INT MidasExceptionFilter(INT * sigargs, INT * mechargs)
03294 {
03295    if (MidasExceptionHandler != NULL)
03296       MidasExceptionHandler();
03297 
03298    return (SS$_RESIGNAL);
03299 }
03300 
03301 void MidasExceptionSignal(INT sig)
03302 {
03303    if (MidasExceptionHandler != NULL)
03304       MidasExceptionHandler();
03305 
03306    kill(getpid(), sig);
03307 }
