03309 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
03310 
03311 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03312 INT ss_exception_handler(void (*func) ())
03313 /********************************************************************\
03314 
03315   Routine: ss_exception_handler
03316 
03317   Purpose: Establish new exception handler which is called before
03318      the program is aborted due to a Ctrl-Break or an access
03319      violation. This handler may clean up things which may
03320      otherwise left in an undefined state.
03321 
03322   Input:
03323     void  (*func)()     Address of handler function
03324   Output:
03325     none
03326 
03327   Function value:
03328     BM_SUCCESS          Successful completion
03329 
03330 \********************************************************************/
03331 {
03332 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03333 
03334    MidasExceptionHandler = func;
03335 /*  SetUnhandledExceptionFilter(
03336     (LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER) MidasExceptionFilter);
03337 
03338   signal(SIGINT, MidasExceptionSignal);
03339   signal(SIGILL, MidasExceptionSignal);
03340   signal(SIGFPE, MidasExceptionSignal);
03341   signal(SIGSEGV, MidasExceptionSignal);
03342   signal(SIGTERM, MidasExceptionSignal);
03343   signal(SIGBREAK, MidasExceptionSignal);
03344   signal(SIGABRT, MidasExceptionSignal); */
03345 
03346 #elif defined (OS_VMS)
03347 
03348    MidasExceptionHandler = func;
03349    lib$establish(MidasExceptionFilter);
03350 
03351    signal(SIGINT, MidasExceptionSignal);
03352    signal(SIGILL, MidasExceptionSignal);
03353    signal(SIGQUIT, MidasExceptionSignal);
03354    signal(SIGFPE, MidasExceptionSignal);
03355    signal(SIGSEGV, MidasExceptionSignal);
03356    signal(SIGTERM, MidasExceptionSignal);
03357 
03358 #else                           /* OS_VMS */
03359    void *p;
03360    p = func;                    /* avoid compiler warning */
03361 #endif
03362 
03363    return SS_SUCCESS;
03364 }
03365 
03366 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03367 
03368 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03369 void *ss_ctrlc_handler(void (*func) (int))
03370 /********************************************************************\
03371 
03372   Routine: ss_ctrlc_handler
03373 
03374   Purpose: Establish new exception handler which is called before
03375      the program is aborted due to a Ctrl-Break. This handler may
03376      clean up things which may otherwise left in an undefined state.
03377 
03378   Input:
03379     void  (*func)(int)     Address of handler function, if NULL
03380                            install default handler
03381 
03382   Output:
03383     none
03384 
03385   Function value:
03386     same as signal()
03387 
03388 \********************************************************************/
03389 {
03390 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03391 
03392    if (func == NULL) {
03393       signal(SIGBREAK, SIG_DFL);
03394       return signal(SIGINT, SIG_DFL);
03395    } else {
03396       signal(SIGBREAK, func);
03397       return signal(SIGINT, func);
03398    }
03399    return NULL;
03400 
03401 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
03402 #ifdef OS_VMS
03403 
03404    return signal(SIGINT, func);
03405 
03406 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
03407 
03408 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03409 
03410    if (func == NULL) {
03411       signal(SIGTERM, SIG_DFL);
03412       return (void *) signal(SIGINT, SIG_DFL);
03413    } else {
03414       signal(SIGTERM, func);
03415       return (void *) signal(SIGINT, func);
03416    }
03417 
03418 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
03419 }
03420 
03421 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03422 /********************************************************************\
03423 *                                                                    *
03424 *                  Suspend/resume functions                          *
03425 *                                                                    *
03426 \********************************************************************/
03427 
03428 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03429 /* globals */
03430 
03431 /*
03432    The suspend structure is used in a multithread environment
03433    (multi thread server) where each thread may resume another thread.
03434    Since all threads share the same global memory, the ports and
03435    sockets for suspending and resuming must be stored in a array
03436    which keeps one entry for each thread.
03437 */
03438 
03439 typedef struct {
03440    BOOL in_use;
03441    INT thread_id;
03442    INT ipc_port;
03443    INT ipc_recv_socket;
03444    INT ipc_send_socket;
03445     INT(*ipc_dispatch) (char *, INT);
03446    INT listen_socket;
03447     INT(*listen_dispatch) (INT);
03448    RPC_SERVER_CONNECTION *server_connection;
03449     INT(*client_dispatch) (INT);
03450    RPC_SERVER_ACCEPTION *server_acception;
03451     INT(*server_dispatch) (INT, int, BOOL);
03452    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
03453 } SUSPEND_STRUCT;
03454 
03455 SUSPEND_STRUCT *_suspend_struct = NULL;
03456 INT _suspend_entries;
03457 
03458 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03459 INT ss_suspend_init_ipc(INT idx)
03460 /********************************************************************\
03461 
03462   Routine: ss_suspend_init_ipc
03463 
03464   Purpose: Create sockets used in the suspend/resume mechanism.
03465 
03466   Input:
03467     INT    idx              Index to the _suspend_struct array for
03468                             the calling thread.
03469   Output:
03470     <indirect>              Set entry in _suspend_struct
03471 
03472   Function value:
03473     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03474     SS_SOCKET_ERROR         Error in socket routines
03475     SS_NO_MEMORY            Not enough memory
03476 
03477 \********************************************************************/
03478 {
03479    INT status, sock;
03480    unsigned int size;
03481    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
03482    char local_host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
03483    struct hostent *phe;
03484 
03485 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03486    {
03487       WSADATA WSAData;
03488 
03489       /* Start windows sockets */
03490       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
03491          return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03492    }
03493 #endif
03494 
03495   /*--------------- create UDP receive socket -------------------*/
03496    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
03497    if (sock == -1)
03498       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03499 
03500    /* let OS choose port for socket */
03501    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
03502    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
03503    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
03504    bind_addr.sin_port = 0;
03505 
03506    gethostname(local_host_name, sizeof(local_host_name));
03507 
03508 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
03509    {
03510       INT host_addr;
03511 
03512       host_addr = hostGetByName(local_host_name);
03513       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
03514    }
03515 #else
03516    phe = gethostbyname(local_host_name);
03517    if (phe == NULL) {
03518       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_suspend_init_ipc", "cannot get host name");
03519       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03520    }
03521    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
03522 #endif
03523 
03524    status = bind(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
03525    if (status < 0)
03526       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03527 
03528    /* find out which port OS has chosen */
03529    size = sizeof(bind_addr);
03530 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03531    getsockname(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &size);
03532 #else
03533    getsockname(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, &size);
03534 #endif
03535 
03536    _suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket = sock;
03537    _suspend_struct[idx].ipc_port = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
03538 
03539   /*--------------- create UDP send socket ----------------------*/
03540    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
03541 
03542    if (sock == -1)
03543       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03544 
03545    /* fill out bind struct pointing to local host */
03546    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
03547    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
03548    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
03549 
03550 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
03551    {
03552       INT host_addr;
03553 
03554       host_addr = hostGetByName(local_host_name);
03555       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
03556    }
03557 #else
03558    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
03559 #endif
03560 
03561    memcpy(&_suspend_struct[idx].bind_addr, &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
03562    _suspend_struct[idx].ipc_send_socket = sock;
03563 
03564    return SS_SUCCESS;
03565 }
03566 
03567 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03568 INT ss_suspend_get_index(INT * pindex)
03569 /********************************************************************\
03570 
03571   Routine: ss_suspend_init
03572 
03573   Purpose: Return the index for the suspend structure for this
03574      thread.
03575 
03576   Input:
03577     none
03578 
03579   Output:
03580     INT    *pindex          Index to the _suspend_struct array for
03581                             the calling thread.
03582 
03583   Function value:
03584     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03585     SS_NO_MEMORY            Not enough memory
03586 
03587 \********************************************************************/
03588 {
03589    INT idx;
03590 
03591    if (_suspend_struct == NULL) {
03592       /* create a new entry for this thread */
03593       _suspend_struct = (SUSPEND_STRUCT *) malloc(sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT));
03594       memset(_suspend_struct, 0, sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT));
03595       if (_suspend_struct == NULL)
03596          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
03597 
03598       _suspend_entries = 1;
03599       *pindex = 0;
03600       _suspend_struct[0].thread_id = ss_gettid();
03601       _suspend_struct[0].in_use = TRUE;
03602    } else {
03603       /* check for an existing entry for this thread */
03604       for (idx = 0; idx < _suspend_entries; idx++)
03605          if (_suspend_struct[idx].thread_id == ss_gettid()) {
03606             if (pindex != NULL)
03607                *pindex = idx;
03608 
03609             return SS_SUCCESS;
03610          }
03611 
03612       /* check for a deleted entry */
03613       for (idx = 0; idx < _suspend_entries; idx++)
03614          if (!_suspend_struct[idx].in_use)
03615             break;
03616 
03617       if (idx == _suspend_entries) {
03618          /* if not found, create new one */
03619          _suspend_struct = (SUSPEND_STRUCT *) realloc(_suspend_struct, sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT) * (_suspend_entries + 1));
03620          memset(&_suspend_struct[_suspend_entries], 0, sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT));
03621 
03622          _suspend_entries++;
03623          if (_suspend_struct == NULL) {
03624             _suspend_entries--;
03625             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
03626          }
03627       }
03628       *pindex = idx;
03629       _suspend_struct[idx].thread_id = ss_gettid();
03630       _suspend_struct[idx].in_use = TRUE;
03631    }
03632 
03633    return SS_SUCCESS;
03634 }
03635 
03636 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03637 INT ss_suspend_exit()
03638 /********************************************************************\
03639 
03640   Routine: ss_suspend_exit
03641 
03642   Purpose: Closes the sockets used in the suspend/resume mechanism.
03643      Should be called before a thread exits.
03644 
03645   Input:
03646     none
03647 
03648   Output:
03649     none
03650 
03651   Function value:
03652     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03653 
03654 \********************************************************************/
03655 {
03656    INT i, status;
03657 
03658    status = ss_suspend_get_index(&i);
03659 
03660    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03661       return status;
03662 
03663    if (_suspend_struct[i].ipc_recv_socket) {
03664       closesocket(_suspend_struct[i].ipc_recv_socket);
03665       closesocket(_suspend_struct[i].ipc_send_socket);
03666    }
03667 
03668    memset(&_suspend_struct[i], 0, sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT));
03669 
03670    /* calculate new _suspend_entries value */
03671    for (i = _suspend_entries - 1; i >= 0; i--)
03672       if (_suspend_struct[i].in_use)
03673          break;
03674 
03675    _suspend_entries = i + 1;
03676 
03677    if (_suspend_entries == 0) {
03678       free(_suspend_struct);
03679       _suspend_struct = NULL;
03680    }
03681 
03682    return SS_SUCCESS;
03683 }
03684 
03685 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03686 INT ss_suspend_set_dispatch(INT channel, void *connection, INT(*dispatch) ())
03687 /********************************************************************\
03688 
03689   Routine: ss_suspend_set_dispatch
03690 
03691   Purpose: Set dispatch functions which get called whenever new data
03692      on various sockets arrive inside the ss_suspend function.
03693 
03694      Beside the Inter Process Communication socket several other
03695      sockets can simultanously watched: A "listen" socket for
03696      a server main thread, server sockets which receive new
03697      RPC requests from remote clients (given by the
03698      server_acception array) and client sockets which may
03699      get notification data from remote servers (such as
03700      database updates).
03701 
03702   Input:
03703     INT    channel               One of CH_IPC, CH_CLIENT,
03704          CH_SERVER, CH_MSERVER
03705 
03706     INT    (*dispatch())         Function being called
03707 
03708   Output:
03709     none
03710 
03711   Function value:
03712     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03713 
03714 \********************************************************************/
03715 {
03716    INT i, status;
03717 
03718    status = ss_suspend_get_index(&i);
03719 
03720    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03721       return status;
03722 
03723    if (channel == CH_IPC) {
03724       _suspend_struct[i].ipc_dispatch = (INT(*)(char *, INT)) dispatch;
03725 
03726       if (!_suspend_struct[i].ipc_recv_socket)
03727          ss_suspend_init_ipc(i);
03728    }
03729 
03730    if (channel == CH_LISTEN) {
03731       _suspend_struct[i].listen_socket = *((INT *) connection);
03732       _suspend_struct[i].listen_dispatch = (INT(*)(INT)) dispatch;
03733    }
03734 
03735    if (channel == CH_CLIENT) {
03736       _suspend_struct[i].server_connection = (RPC_SERVER_CONNECTION *) connection;
03737       _suspend_struct[i].client_dispatch = (INT(*)(INT)) dispatch;
03738    }
03739 
03740    if (channel == CH_SERVER) {
03741       _suspend_struct[i].server_acception = (RPC_SERVER_ACCEPTION *) connection;
03742       _suspend_struct[i].server_dispatch = (INT(*)(INT, int, BOOL)) dispatch;
03743    }
03744 
03745    return SS_SUCCESS;
03746 }
03747 
03748 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03749 INT ss_suspend_get_port(INT * port)
03750 /********************************************************************\
03751 
03752   Routine: ss_suspend_get_port
03753 
03754   Purpose: Return the UDP port number which can be used to resume
03755      the calling thread inside a ss_suspend function. The port
03756      number can then be used by another process as a para-
03757      meter to the ss_resume function to resume the thread
03758      which called ss_suspend.
03759 
03760   Input:
03761     none
03762 
03763   Output:
03764     INT    *port            UDP port number
03765 
03766   Function value:
03767     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03768 
03769 \********************************************************************/
03770 {
03771    INT idx, status;
03772 
03773    status = ss_suspend_get_index(&idx);
03774 
03775    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03776       return status;
03777 
03778    if (!_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_port)
03779       ss_suspend_init_ipc(idx);
03780 
03781    *port = _suspend_struct[idx].ipc_port;
03782 
03783    return SS_SUCCESS;
03784 }
03785 
03786 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03787 INT ss_suspend(INT millisec, INT msg)
03788 /********************************************************************\
03789 
03790   Routine: ss_suspend
03791 
03792   Purpose: Suspend the calling thread for a speficic time. If
03793      timeout (in millisec.) is negative, the thead is suspended
03794      indefinitely. It can only be resumed from another thread
03795      or process which calls ss_resume or by some data which
03796      arrives on the client or server sockets.
03797 
03798      If msg equals to one of MSG_BM, MSG_ODB, the function
03799      return whenever such a message is received.
03800 
03801   Input:
03802     INT    millisec         Timeout in milliseconds
03803     INT    msg              Return from ss_suspend when msg
03804           (MSG_BM, MSG_ODB) is received.
03805 
03806   Output:
03807     none
03808 
03809   Function value:
03810     SS_SUCCESS              Requested message was received
03811     SS_TIMEOUT              Timeout expired
03812     SS_SERVER_RECV          Server channel got data
03813     SS_CLIENT_RECV          Client channel got data
03814     SS_ABORT (RPC_ABORT)    Connection lost
03815     SS_EXIT                 Connection closed
03816 
03817 \********************************************************************/
03818 {
03819    fd_set readfds;
03820    struct timeval timeout;
03821    INT sock, server_socket;
03822    INT idx, status, i, return_status;
03823    unsigned int size;
03824    struct sockaddr from_addr;
03825    char str[100], buffer[80], buffer_tmp[80];
03826 
03827    /* get index to _suspend_struct for this thread */
03828    status = ss_suspend_get_index(&idx);
03829 
03830    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03831       return status;
03832 
03833    return_status = SS_TIMEOUT;
03834 
03835    do {
03836       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
03837 
03838       /* check listen socket */
03839       if (_suspend_struct[idx].listen_socket)
03840          FD_SET(_suspend_struct[idx].listen_socket, &readfds);
03841 
03842       /* check server channels */
03843       if (_suspend_struct[idx].server_acception)
03844          for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++) {
03845             /* RPC channel */
03846             sock = _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].recv_sock;
03847 
03848             /* only watch the event tcp connection belonging to this thread */
03849             if (!sock || _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].tid != ss_gettid())
03850                continue;
03851 
03852             /* watch server socket if no data in cache */
03853             if (recv_tcp_check(sock) == 0)
03854                FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
03855             /* set timeout to zero if data in cache (-> just quick check IPC)
03856                and not called from inside bm_send_event (-> wait for IPC) */
03857             else if (msg == 0)
03858                millisec = 0;
03859 
03860             /* event channel */
03861             sock = _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].event_sock;
03862 
03863             if (!sock)
03864                continue;
03865 
03866             /* watch server socket if no data in cache */
03867             if (recv_event_check(sock) == 0)
03868                FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
03869             /* set timeout to zero if data in cache (-> just quick check IPC)
03870                and not called from inside bm_send_event (-> wait for IPC) */
03871             else if (msg == 0)
03872                millisec = 0;
03873          }
03874 
03875       /* watch client recv connections */
03876       if (_suspend_struct[idx].server_connection) {
03877          sock = _suspend_struct[idx].server_connection->recv_sock;
03878          if (sock)
03879             FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
03880       }
03881 
03882       /* check IPC socket */
03883       if (_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket)
03884          FD_SET(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds);
03885 
03886       timeout.tv_sec = millisec / 1000;
03887       timeout.tv_usec = (millisec % 1000) * 1000;
03888 
03889       do {
03890          if (millisec < 0)
03891             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, NULL);    /* blocking */
03892          else
03893             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
03894 
03895          /* if an alarm signal was cought, restart select with reduced timeout */
03896          if (status == -1 && timeout.tv_sec >= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000)
03897             timeout.tv_sec -= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000;
03898 
03899       } while (status == -1);   /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
03900 
03901       /* if listen socket got data, call dispatcher with socket */
03902       if (_suspend_struct[idx].listen_socket && FD_ISSET(_suspend_struct[idx].listen_socket, &readfds)) {
03903          sock = _suspend_struct[idx].listen_socket;
03904 
03905          if (_suspend_struct[idx].listen_dispatch) {
03906             status = _suspend_struct[idx].listen_dispatch(sock);
03907             if (status == RPC_SHUTDOWN)
03908                return status;
03909          }
03910       }
03911 
03912       /* check server channels */
03913       if (_suspend_struct[idx].server_acception)
03914          for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++) {
03915             /* rpc channel */
03916             sock = _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].recv_sock;
03917 
03918             /* only watch the event tcp connection belonging to this thread */
03919             if (!sock || _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].tid != ss_gettid())
03920                continue;
03921 
03922             //printf("rpc index %d, socket %d, hostname \'%s\', progname \'%s\'\n", i, sock, _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].host_name, _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].prog_name);
03923 
03924             if (recv_tcp_check(sock) || FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
03925                if (_suspend_struct[idx].server_dispatch) {
03926                   status = _suspend_struct[idx].server_dispatch(i, sock, msg != 0);
03927                   _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].last_activity = ss_millitime();
03928 
03929                   if (status == SS_ABORT || status == SS_EXIT || status == RPC_SHUTDOWN)
03930                      return status;
03931 
03932                   return_status = SS_SERVER_RECV;
03933                }
03934             }
03935 
03936             /* event channel */
03937             sock = _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].event_sock;
03938             if (!sock)
03939                continue;
03940 
03941             if (recv_event_check(sock) || FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
03942                if (_suspend_struct[idx].server_dispatch) {
03943                   status = _suspend_struct[idx].server_dispatch(i, sock, msg != 0);
03944                   _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].last_activity = ss_millitime();
03945 
03946                   if (status == SS_ABORT || status == SS_EXIT || status == RPC_SHUTDOWN)
03947                      return status;
03948 
03949                   return_status = SS_SERVER_RECV;
03950                }
03951             }
03952          }
03953 
03954       /* check server message channels */
03955       if (_suspend_struct[idx].server_connection) {
03956          sock = _suspend_struct[idx].server_connection->recv_sock;
03957 
03958          if (sock && FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
03959             if (_suspend_struct[idx].client_dispatch)
03960                status = _suspend_struct[idx].client_dispatch(sock);
03961             else {
03962                status = SS_SUCCESS;
03963                size = recv_tcp(sock, buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0);
03964 
03965                if (size <= 0)
03966                   status = SS_ABORT;
03967             }
03968 
03969             if (status == SS_ABORT) {
03970                sprintf(str, "Server connection broken to \'%s\'", _suspend_struct[idx].server_connection->host_name);
03971                cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_suspend", str);
03972 
03973                /* close client connection if link broken */
03974                closesocket(_suspend_struct[idx].server_connection->send_sock);
03975                closesocket(_suspend_struct[idx].server_connection->recv_sock);
03976                closesocket(_suspend_struct[idx].server_connection->event_sock);
03977 
03978                memset(_suspend_struct[idx].server_connection, 0, sizeof(RPC_CLIENT_CONNECTION));
03979 
03980                /* exit program after broken connection to MIDAS server */
03981                return SS_ABORT;
03982             }
03983 
03984             return_status = SS_CLIENT_RECV;
03985          }
03986       }
03987 
03988       /* check IPC socket */
03989       if (_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket && FD_ISSET(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds)) {
03990          /* receive IPC message */
03991          size = sizeof(struct sockaddr);
03992 #ifdef OS_WINNT
03993          size = recvfrom(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket, buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0, &from_addr, (int *) &size);
03994 #else
03995          size = recvfrom(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket, buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0, &from_addr, &size);
03996 #endif
03997 
03998          /* find out if this thread is connected as a server */
03999          server_socket = 0;
04000          if (_suspend_struct[idx].server_acception && rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
04001             for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++) {
04002                sock = _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].send_sock;
04003                if (sock && _suspend_struct[idx].server_acception[i].tid == ss_gettid())
04004                   server_socket = sock;
04005             }
04006 
04007          /* receive further messages to empty UDP queue */
04008          do {
04009             FD_ZERO(&readfds);
04010             FD_SET(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds);
04011 
04012             timeout.tv_sec = 0;
04013             timeout.tv_usec = 0;
04014 
04015             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
04016 
04017             if (status != -1 && FD_ISSET(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds)) {
04018                size = sizeof(struct sockaddr);
04019                size =
04020 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04021                    recvfrom(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket,
04022                             buffer_tmp, sizeof(buffer_tmp), 0, &from_addr, (int *) &size);
04023 #else
04024                    recvfrom(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket, buffer_tmp, sizeof(buffer_tmp), 0, &from_addr, &size);
04025 #endif
04026 
04027                /* don't forward same MSG_BM as above */
04028                if (buffer_tmp[0] != 'B' || strcmp(buffer_tmp, buffer) != 0)
04029                   if (_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_dispatch)
04030                      _suspend_struct[idx].ipc_dispatch(buffer_tmp, server_socket);
04031             }
04032 
04033          } while (FD_ISSET(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds));
04034 
04035          /* return if received requested message */
04036          if (msg == MSG_BM && buffer[0] == 'B')
04037             return SS_SUCCESS;
04038          if (msg == MSG_ODB && buffer[0] == 'O')
04039             return SS_SUCCESS;
04040 
04041          /* call dispatcher */
04042          if (_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_dispatch)
04043             _suspend_struct[idx].ipc_dispatch(buffer, server_socket);
04044 
04045          return_status = SS_SUCCESS;
04046       }
04047 
04048    } while (millisec < 0);
04049 
04050    return return_status;
04051 }
04052 
04053 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04054 INT ss_resume(INT port, char *message)
04055 /********************************************************************\
04056 
04057   Routine: ss_resume
04058 
04059   Purpose: Resume another thread or process which called ss_suspend.
04060      The port has to be transfered (shared memory or so) from
04061      the thread or process which should be resumed. In that
04062      process it can be obtained via ss_suspend_get_port.
04063 
04064   Input:
04065     INT    port             UDP port number
04066     INT    msg              Mesage id & parameter transferred to
04067     INT    param              target process
04068 
04069   Output:
04070     none
04071 
04072   Function value:
04073     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04074     SS_SOCKET_ERROR         Socket error
04075 
04076 \********************************************************************/
04077 {
04078    INT status, idx;
04079 
04080    if (ss_in_async_routine_flag) {
04081       /* if called from watchdog, tid is different under NT! */
04082       idx = 0;
04083    } else {
04084       status = ss_suspend_get_index(&idx);
04085 
04086       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
04087          return status;
04088    }
04089 
04090    _suspend_struct[idx].bind_addr.sin_port = htons((short) port);
04091 
04092    status = sendto(_suspend_struct[idx].ipc_send_socket, message,
04093                    strlen(message) + 1, 0,
04094                    (struct sockaddr *) &_suspend_struct[idx].bind_addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
04095 
04096    if (status != (INT) strlen(message) + 1)
04097       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
04098 
04099    return SS_SUCCESS;
04100 }
04101 
04102 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04103 /********************************************************************\
04104 *                                                                    *
04105 *                     Network functions                              *
04106 *                                                                    *
04107 \********************************************************************/
04108 
04109 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04110 INT send_tcp(int sock, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags)
04111 /********************************************************************\
04112 
04113   Routine: send_tcp
04114 
04115   Purpose: Send network data over TCP port. Break buffer in smaller
04116            parts if larger than maximum TCP buffer size (usually 64k).
04117 
04118   Input:
04119     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
04120     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
04121     INT   flags              Flags passed to send()
04122                              0x10000 : do not send error message
04123 
04124   Output:
04125     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
04126 
04127   Function value:
04128     INT                     Same as send()
04129 
04130 \********************************************************************/
04131 {
04132    DWORD count;
04133    INT status;
04134    //int net_tcp_size = NET_TCP_SIZE;
04135    int net_tcp_size = 1024 * 1024;
04136 
04137    /* transfer fragments until complete buffer is transferred */
04138 
04139    for (count = 0; (INT) count < (INT) buffer_size - net_tcp_size;) {
04140       status = send(sock, buffer + count, net_tcp_size, flags & 0xFFFF);
04141       if (status != -1)
04142          count += status;
04143       else {
04144 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04145          if (errno == EINTR)
04146             continue;
04147 #endif
04148          if ((flags & 0x10000) == 0)
04149             cm_msg(MERROR, "send_tcp",
04150                    "send(socket=%d,size=%d) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)",
04151                    sock, net_tcp_size, status, errno, strerror(errno));
04152          return status;
04153       }
04154    }
04155 
04156    while (count < buffer_size) {
04157       status = send(sock, buffer + count, buffer_size - count, flags & 0xFFFF);
04158       if (status != -1)
04159          count += status;
04160       else {
04161 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04162          if (errno == EINTR)
04163             continue;
04164 #endif
04165          if ((flags & 0x10000) == 0)
04166             cm_msg(MERROR, "send_tcp",
04167                    "send(socket=%d,size=%d) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)",
04168                    sock, (int) (buffer_size - count), status, errno, strerror(errno));
04169          return status;
04170       }
04171    }
04172 
04173    return count;
04174 }
04175 
04176 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04177 INT recv_string(int sock, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT millisec)
04178 /********************************************************************\
04179 
04180   Routine: recv_string
04181 
04182   Purpose: Receive network data over TCP port. Since sockets are
04183      operated in stream mode, a single transmission via send
04184      may not transfer the full data. Therefore, one has to check
04185      at the receiver side if the full data is received. If not,
04186      one has to issue several recv() commands.
04187 
04188      The length of the data is determined by a trailing zero.
04189 
04190   Input:
04191     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
04192     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
04193     INT   millisec           Timeout in ms
04194 
04195   Output:
04196     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
04197 
04198   Function value:
04199     INT                      String length
04200 
04201 \********************************************************************/
04202 {
04203    INT i, status;
04204    DWORD n;
04205    fd_set readfds;
04206    struct timeval timeout;
04207 
04208    n = 0;
04209    memset(buffer, 0, buffer_size);
04210 
04211    do {
04212       if (millisec > 0) {
04213          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
04214          FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
04215 
04216          timeout.tv_sec = millisec / 1000;
04217          timeout.tv_usec = (millisec % 1000) * 1000;
04218 
04219          do {
04220             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
04221          } while (status == -1);        /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
04222 
04223          if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
04224             break;
04225       }
04226 
04227       i = recv(sock, buffer + n, 1, 0);
04228 
04229       if (i <= 0)
04230          break;
04231 
04232       n++;
04233 
04234       if (n >= buffer_size)
04235          break;
04236 
04237    } while (buffer[n - 1] && buffer[n - 1] != 10);
04238 
04239    return n - 1;
04240 }
04241 
04242 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04243 INT recv_tcp(int sock, char *net_buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags)
04244 /********************************************************************\
04245 
04246   Routine: recv_tcp
04247 
04248   Purpose: Receive network data over TCP port. Since sockets are
04249      operated in stream mode, a single transmission via send
04250      may not transfer the full data. Therefore, one has to check
04251      at the receiver side if the full data is received. If not,
04252      one has to issue several recv() commands.
04253 
04254      The length of the data is determined by the data header,
04255      which consists of two DWORDs. The first is the command code
04256      (or function id), the second is the size of the following
04257      parameters in bytes. From that size recv_tcp() determines
04258      how much data to receive.
04259 
04260   Input:
04261     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
04262     char  *net_buffer        Buffer to store data to
04263     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
04264     INT   flags              Flags passed to recv()
04265 
04266   Output:
04267     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
04268 
04269   Function value:
04270     INT                      Same as recv()
04271 
04272 \********************************************************************/
04273 {
04274    INT param_size, n_received, n;
04275    NET_COMMAND *nc;
04276 
04277    if (buffer_size < sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER)) {
04278       cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp", "parameters too large for network buffer");
04279       return -1;
04280    }
04281 
04282    /* first receive header */
04283    n_received = 0;
04284    do {
04285 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04286       do {
04287          n = recv(sock, net_buffer + n_received, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), flags);
04288 
04289          /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
04290       } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04291 #else
04292       n = recv(sock, net_buffer + n_received, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), flags);
04293 #endif
04294 
04295       if (n == 0) {
04296          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp",
04297                 "header: recv returned %d, n_received = %d, unexpected connection closure", n, n_received);
04298          return n;
04299       }
04300 
04301       if (n < 0) {
04302          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp",
04303                 "header: recv returned %d, n_received = %d, errno: %d (%s)", n, n_received, errno, strerror(errno));
04304          return n;
04305       }
04306 
04307       n_received += n;
04308 
04309    } while (n_received < (int) sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER));
04310 
04311    /* now receive parameters */
04312 
04313    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) net_buffer;
04314    param_size = nc->header.param_size;
04315    n_received = 0;
04316 
04317    if (param_size == 0)
04318       return sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
04319 
04320    if (param_size > (INT)buffer_size) {
04321       cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp", "param: receive buffer size %d is too small for received data size %d", buffer_size, param_size);
04322       return -1;
04323    }
04324 
04325    do {
04326 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04327       do {
04328          n = recv(sock, net_buffer + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + n_received, param_size - n_received, flags);
04329 
04330          /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
04331       } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04332 #else
04333       n = recv(sock, net_buffer + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + n_received, param_size - n_received, flags);
04334 #endif
04335 
04336       if (n == 0) {
04337          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp",
04338                 "param: recv returned %d, n_received = %d, unexpected connection closure", n, n_received);
04339          return n;
04340       }
04341 
04342       if (n < 0) {
04343          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp",
04344                 "param: recv returned %d, n_received = %d, errno: %d (%s)", n, n_received, errno, strerror(errno));
04345          return n;
04346       }
04347 
04348       n_received += n;
04349    } while (n_received < param_size);
04350 
04351    return sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + param_size;
04352 }
04353 
04354 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04355 INT send_udp(int sock, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags)
04356 /********************************************************************\
04357 
04358   Routine: send_udp
04359 
04360   Purpose: Send network data over UDP port. If buffer_size is small,
04361      collect several events and send them together. If
04362      buffer_size is larger than largest datagram size
04363      NET_UDP_SIZE, split event in several udp buffers and
04364      send them separately with serial number protection.
04365 
04366   Input:
04367     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
04368     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
04369     INT   flags              Flags passed to send()
04370 
04371   Output:
04372     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
04373 
04374   Function value:
04375     INT                     Same as send()
04376 
04377 \********************************************************************/
04378 {
04379    INT status;
04380    UDP_HEADER *udp_header;
04381    static char udp_buffer[NET_UDP_SIZE];
04382    static INT serial_number = 0, n_received = 0;
04383    DWORD i, data_size;
04384 
04385    udp_header = (UDP_HEADER *) udp_buffer;
04386    data_size = NET_UDP_SIZE - sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
04387 
04388    /*
04389       If buffer size is between half the UPD size and full UDP size,
04390       send immediately a single packet.
04391     */
04392    if (buffer_size >= NET_UDP_SIZE / 2 && buffer_size <= data_size) {
04393       /*
04394          If there is any data already in the buffer, send it first.
04395        */
04396       if (n_received) {
04397          udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
04398          udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
04399 
04400          send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
04401          n_received = 0;
04402       }
04403 
04404       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | buffer_size;
04405       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
04406 
04407       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer, buffer_size);
04408       status = send(sock, udp_buffer, buffer_size + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
04409       if (status == (INT) buffer_size + (int) sizeof(UDP_HEADER))
04410          status -= sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
04411 
04412       return status;
04413    }
04414 
04415    /*
04416       If buffer size is smaller than half the UDP size, collect events
04417       until UDP buffer is optimal filled.
04418     */
04419    if (buffer_size <= data_size) {
04420       /* If udp_buffer has space, just copy it there */
04421       if (buffer_size + n_received < data_size) {
04422          memcpy(udp_buffer + sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + n_received, buffer, buffer_size);
04423 
04424          n_received += buffer_size;
04425          return buffer_size;
04426       }
04427 
04428       /* If udp_buffer has not enough space, send it */
04429       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
04430       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
04431 
04432       status = send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
04433 
04434       n_received = 0;
04435 
04436       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer, buffer_size);
04437       n_received = buffer_size;
04438 
04439       return buffer_size;
04440    }
04441 
04442    /*
04443       If buffer size is larger than UDP size, split event in several
04444       buffers.
04445     */
04446 
04447    /* If there is any data already in the buffer, send it first */
04448    if (n_received) {
04449       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
04450       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
04451 
04452       send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
04453       n_received = 0;
04454    }
04455 
04456    for (i = 0; i < ((buffer_size - 1) / data_size); i++) {
04457       if (i == 0) {
04458          udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | buffer_size;
04459          udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
04460       } else {
04461          udp_header->serial_number = serial_number;
04462          udp_header->sequence_number = i;
04463       }
04464 
04465       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer + i * data_size, data_size);
04466       send(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04467    }
04468 
04469    /* Send remaining bytes */
04470    udp_header->serial_number = serial_number;
04471    udp_header->sequence_number = i;
04472    memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer + i * data_size, buffer_size - i * data_size);
04473    status = send(sock, udp_buffer, sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + buffer_size - i * data_size, flags);
04474    if ((DWORD) status == sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + buffer_size - i * data_size)
04475       return buffer_size;
04476 
04477    return status;
04478 }
04479 
04480 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04481 INT recv_udp(int sock, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags)
04482 /********************************************************************\
04483 
04484   Routine: recv_udp
04485 
04486   Purpose: Receive network data over UDP port. If received event
04487      is splitted into several buffers, recombine them checking
04488      the serial number. If one buffer is missing in a splitted
04489      event, throw away the whole event.
04490 
04491   Input:
04492     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
04493     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
04494     INT   flags              Flags passed to recv()
04495 
04496   Output:
04497     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
04498 
04499   Function value:
04500     INT                     Same as recv()
04501 
04502 \********************************************************************/
04503 {
04504    INT i, status;
04505    UDP_HEADER *udp_header;
04506    char udp_buffer[NET_UDP_SIZE];
04507    DWORD serial_number, sequence_number, total_buffer_size;
04508    DWORD data_size, n_received;
04509    fd_set readfds;
04510    struct timeval timeout;
04511 
04512    udp_header = (UDP_HEADER *) udp_buffer;
04513    data_size = NET_UDP_SIZE - sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
04514 
04515    /* Receive the first buffer */
04516 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04517    do {
04518       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04519 
04520       /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
04521    } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04522 #else
04523    i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04524 #endif
04525 
04526  start:
04527 
04528    /* Receive buffers until we get a sequence start */
04529    while (!(udp_header->serial_number & UDP_FIRST)) {
04530       /* wait for data with timeout */
04531       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
04532       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
04533 
04534       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
04535       timeout.tv_usec = 100000; /* 0.1 s */
04536 
04537       do {
04538          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
04539       } while (status == -1);
04540 
04541       /*
04542          If we got nothing, return zero so that calling program can do
04543          other things like checking TCP port for example.
04544        */
04545       if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
04546          return 0;
04547 
04548 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04549       do {
04550          i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04551 
04552          /* dont return if an alarm signal was caught */
04553       } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04554 #else
04555       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04556 #endif
04557    }
04558 
04559    /* if no others are following, return */
04560    total_buffer_size = udp_header->serial_number & ~UDP_FIRST;
04561    serial_number = udp_header->sequence_number;
04562    sequence_number = 0;
04563 
04564    if (total_buffer_size <= data_size) {
04565       if (buffer_size < total_buffer_size) {
04566          memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, buffer_size);
04567          return buffer_size;
04568       } else {
04569          memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, total_buffer_size);
04570          return total_buffer_size;
04571       }
04572    }
04573 
04574    /* if others are following, collect them */
04575    n_received = data_size;
04576 
04577    if (buffer_size < data_size) {
04578       memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, buffer_size);
04579       return buffer_size;
04580    }
04581 
04582    memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, data_size);
04583 
04584 
04585    do {
04586       /* wait for new data with timeout */
04587       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
04588       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
04589 
04590       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
04591       timeout.tv_usec = 100000; /* 0.1 s */
04592 
04593       do {
04594          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
04595       } while (status == -1);
04596 
04597       /*
04598          If we got nothing, return zero so that calling program can do
04599          other things like checking TCP port for example.
04600        */
04601       if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
04602          return 0;
04603 
04604 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04605       do {
04606          i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04607 
04608          /* dont return if an alarm signal was caught */
04609       } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04610 #else
04611       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04612 #endif
04613 
04614       sequence_number++;
04615 
04616       /* check sequence and serial numbers */
04617       if (udp_header->serial_number != serial_number || udp_header->sequence_number != sequence_number)
04618          /* lost one, so start again */
04619          goto start;
04620 
04621       /* copy what we got */
04622       memcpy(buffer + n_received, udp_header + 1, i - sizeof(UDP_HEADER));
04623 
04624       n_received += (i - sizeof(UDP_HEADER));
04625 
04626    } while (n_received < total_buffer_size);
04627 
04628    return n_received;
04629 }
04630 
04631 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04632 
04633 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
04634 #ifdef sopen
04635 /********************************************************************\
04636    under Turbo-C, sopen is defined as a macro instead a function.
04637    Since the PCTCP library uses sopen as a function call, we supply
04638    it here.
04639 \********************************************************************/
04640 
04641 #undef sopen
04642 
04643 int sopen(const char *path, int access, int shflag, int mode)
04644 {
04645    return open(path, (access) | (shflag), mode);
04646 }
04647 
04648 #endif
04649 #endif
04650 
04651 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04652 /********************************************************************\
04653 *                                                                    *
04654 *                     Tape functions                                 *
04655 *                                                                    *
04656 \********************************************************************/
04657 
04658 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04659 INT ss_tape_open(char *path, INT oflag, INT * channel)
04660 /********************************************************************\
04661 
04662   Routine: ss_tape_open
04663 
04664   Purpose: Open tape channel
04665 
04666   Input:
04667     char  *path             Name of tape
04668                             Under Windows NT, usually \\.\tape0
04669                             Under UNIX, usually /dev/tape
04670     INT   oflag             Open flags, same as open()
04671 
04672   Output:
04673     INT   *channel          Channel identifier
04674 
04675   Function value:
04676     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04677     SS_NO_TAPE              No tape in device
04678     SS_DEV_BUSY             Device is used by someone else
04679 
04680 \********************************************************************/
04681 {
04682 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04683    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
04684 
04685    *channel = open(path, oflag, 0644);
04686 
04687    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
04688 
04689    if (*channel < 0)
04690       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", strerror(errno));
04691 
04692    if (*channel < 0) {
04693       if (errno == EIO)
04694          return SS_NO_TAPE;
04695       if (errno == EBUSY)
04696          return SS_DEV_BUSY;
04697       return errno;
04698    }
04699 #ifdef MTSETBLK
04700    {
04701    /* set variable block size */
04702    struct mtop arg;
04703    arg.mt_op = MTSETBLK;
04704    arg.mt_count = 0;
04705 
04706    ioctl(*channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
04707    }
04708 #endif                          /* MTSETBLK */
04709 
04710 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04711 
04712 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04713    INT status;
04714    TAPE_GET_MEDIA_PARAMETERS m;
04715 
04716    *channel = (INT) CreateFile(path, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE, 0, 0, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
04717 
04718    if (*channel == (INT) INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
04719       status = GetLastError();
04720       if (status == ERROR_SHARING_VIOLATION) {
04721          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", "tape is used by other process");
04722          return SS_DEV_BUSY;
04723       }
04724       if (status == ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND) {
04725          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", "tape device \"%s\" doesn't exist", path);
04726          return SS_NO_TAPE;
04727       }
04728 
04729       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", "unknown error %d", status);
04730       return status;
04731    }
04732 
04733    status = GetTapeStatus((HANDLE) (*channel));
04734    if (status == ERROR_NO_MEDIA_IN_DRIVE || status == ERROR_BUS_RESET) {
04735       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", "no media in drive");
04736       return SS_NO_TAPE;
04737    }
04738 
04739    /* set block size */
04740    memset(&m, 0, sizeof(m));
04741    m.BlockSize = TAPE_BUFFER_SIZE;
04742    SetTapeParameters((HANDLE) (*channel), SET_TAPE_MEDIA_INFORMATION, &m);
04743 
04744 #endif
04745 
04746    return SS_SUCCESS;
04747 }
04748 
04749 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04750 INT ss_tape_close(INT channel)
04751 /********************************************************************\
04752 
04753   Routine: ss_tape_close
04754 
04755   Purpose: Close tape channel
04756 
04757   Input:
04758     INT   channel           Channel identifier
04759 
04760   Output:
04761     <none>
04762 
04763   Function value:
04764     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04765     errno                   Low level error number
04766 
04767 \********************************************************************/
04768 {
04769    INT status;
04770 
04771 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04772 
04773    status = close(channel);
04774 
04775    if (status < 0) {
04776       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_close", strerror(errno));
04777       return errno;
04778    }
04779 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04780 
04781 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04782 
04783    if (!CloseHandle((HANDLE) channel)) {
04784       status = GetLastError();
04785       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_close", "unknown error %d", status);
04786       return status;
04787    }
04788 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04789 
04790    return SS_SUCCESS;
04791 }
04792 
04793 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04794 INT ss_tape_status(char *path)
04795 /********************************************************************\
04796 
04797   Routine: ss_tape_status
04798 
04799   Purpose: Print status information about tape
04800 
04801   Input:
04802     char  *path             Name of tape
04803 
04804   Output:
04805     <print>                 Tape information
04806 
04807   Function value:
04808     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04809 
04810 \********************************************************************/
04811 {
04812 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04813    char str[256];
04814    /* let 'mt' do the job */
04815    sprintf(str, "mt -f %s status", path);
04816    system(str);
04817 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04818 
04819 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04820    INT status, channel;
04821    DWORD size;
04822    TAPE_GET_MEDIA_PARAMETERS m;
04823    TAPE_GET_DRIVE_PARAMETERS d;
04824    double x;
04825 
04826    channel = (INT) CreateFile(path, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE, 0, 0, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
04827 
04828    if (channel == (INT) INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
04829       status = GetLastError();
04830       if (status == ERROR_SHARING_VIOLATION) {
04831          cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_tape_status", "tape is used by other process");
04832          return SS_SUCCESS;
04833       }
04834       if (status == ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND) {
04835          cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_tape_status", "tape device \"%s\" doesn't exist", path);
04836          return SS_SUCCESS;
04837       }
04838 
04839       cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_tape_status", "unknown error %d", status);
04840       return status;
04841    }
04842 
04843    /* poll media changed messages */
04844    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_DRIVE_INFORMATION, &size, &d);
04845    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_DRIVE_INFORMATION, &size, &d);
04846 
04847    status = GetTapeStatus((HANDLE) channel);
04848    if (status == ERROR_NO_MEDIA_IN_DRIVE || status == ERROR_BUS_RESET) {
04849       cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_tape_status", "no media in drive");
04850       CloseHandle((HANDLE) channel);
04851       return SS_SUCCESS;
04852    }
04853 
04854    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_DRIVE_INFORMATION, &size, &d);
04855    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_MEDIA_INFORMATION, &size, &m);
04856 
04857    printf("Hardware error correction is %s\n", d.ECC ? "on" : "off");
04858    printf("Hardware compression is %s\n", d.Compression ? "on" : "off");
04859    printf("Tape %s write protected\n", m.WriteProtected ? "is" : "is not");
04860 
04861    if (d.FeaturesLow & TAPE_DRIVE_TAPE_REMAINING) {
04862       x = ((double) m.Remaining.LowPart + (double) m.Remaining.HighPart * 4.294967295E9)
04863           / 1024.0 / 1000.0;
04864       printf("Tape capacity remaining is %d MB\n", (int) x);
04865    } else
04866       printf("Tape capacity is not reported by tape\n");
04867 
04868    CloseHandle((HANDLE) channel);
04869 
04870 #endif
04871 
04872    return SS_SUCCESS;
04873 }
04874 
04875 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04876 INT ss_tape_write(INT channel, void *pdata, INT count)
04877 /********************************************************************\
04878 
04879   Routine: ss_tape_write
04880 
04881   Purpose: Write count bytes to tape channel
04882 
04883   Input:
04884     INT   channel           Channel identifier
04885     void  *pdata            Address of data to write
04886     INT   count             number of bytes
04887 
04888   Output:
04889     <none>
04890 
04891   Function value:
04892     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04893     SS_IO_ERROR             Physical IO error
04894     SS_TAPE_ERROR           Unknown tape error
04895 
04896 \********************************************************************/
04897 {
04898 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04899    INT status;
04900 
04901    do {
04902       status = write(channel, pdata, count);
04903 /*
04904     if (status != count)
04905       printf("count: %d - %d\n", count, status);
04906 */
04907    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04908 
04909    if (status != count) {
04910       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write", strerror(errno));
04911 
04912       if (errno == EIO)
04913          return SS_IO_ERROR;
04914       else
04915          return SS_TAPE_ERROR;
04916    }
04917 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04918 
04919 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04920    INT status;
04921    DWORD written;
04922 
04923    WriteFile((HANDLE) channel, pdata, count, &written, NULL);
04924    if (written != (DWORD) count) {
04925       status = GetLastError();
04926       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write", "error %d", status);
04927 
04928       return SS_IO_ERROR;
04929    }
04930 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04931 
04932    return SS_SUCCESS;
04933 }
04934 
04935 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04936 INT ss_tape_read(INT channel, void *pdata, INT * count)
04937 /********************************************************************\
04938 
04939   Routine: ss_tape_write
04940 
04941   Purpose: Read count bytes to tape channel
04942 
04943   Input:
04944     INT   channel           Channel identifier
04945     void  *pdata            Address of data
04946     INT   *count            Number of bytes to read
04947 
04948   Output:
04949     INT   *count            Number of read
04950 
04951   Function value:
04952     SS_SUCCESS              Successful operation
04953     <errno>                 Error code
04954 
04955 \********************************************************************/
04956 {
04957 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04958    INT n, status;
04959 
04960    do {
04961       n = read(channel, pdata, *count);
04962    } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04963 
04964    if (n == -1) {
04965       if (errno == ENOSPC || errno == EIO)
04966          status = SS_END_OF_TAPE;
04967       else {
04968          if (n == 0 && errno == 0)
04969             status = SS_END_OF_FILE;
04970          else {
04971             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_read", "unexpected tape error: n=%d, errno=%d\n", n, errno);
04972             status = errno;
04973          }
04974       }
04975    } else
04976       status = SS_SUCCESS;
04977    *count = n;
04978 
04979    return status;
04980 
04981 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)         /* OS_UNIX */
04982 
04983    INT status;
04984    DWORD read;
04985 
04986    if (!ReadFile((HANDLE) channel, pdata, *count, &read, NULL)) {
04987       status = GetLastError();
04988       if (status == ERROR_NO_DATA_DETECTED)
04989          status = SS_END_OF_TAPE;
04990       else if (status == ERROR_FILEMARK_DETECTED)
04991          status = SS_END_OF_FILE;
04992       else if (status == ERROR_MORE_DATA)
04993          status = SS_SUCCESS;
04994       else
04995          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_read", "unexpected tape error: n=%d, errno=%d\n", read, status);
04996    } else
04997       status = SS_SUCCESS;
04998 
04999    *count = read;
05000    return status;
05001 
05002 #else                           /* OS_WINNT */
05003 
05004    return SS_SUCCESS;
05005 
05006 #endif
05007 }
05008 
05009 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05010 INT ss_tape_write_eof(INT channel)
05011 /********************************************************************\
05012 
05013   Routine: ss_tape_write_eof
05014 
05015   Purpose: Write end-of-file to tape channel
05016 
05017   Input:
05018     INT   *channel          Channel identifier
05019 
05020   Output:
05021     <none>
05022 
05023   Function value:
05024     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05025     errno                   Error number
05026 
05027 \********************************************************************/
05028 {
05029 #ifdef MTIOCTOP
05030    struct mtop arg;
05031    INT status;
05032 
05033    arg.mt_op = MTWEOF;
05034    arg.mt_count = 1;
05035 
05036    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
05037 
05038    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
05039 
05040    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
05041 
05042    if (status < 0) {
05043       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write_eof", strerror(errno));
05044       return errno;
05045    }
05046 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
05047 
05048 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05049 
05050    TAPE_GET_DRIVE_PARAMETERS d;
05051    DWORD size;
05052    INT status;
05053 
05054    size = sizeof(TAPE_GET_DRIVE_PARAMETERS);
05055    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_DRIVE_INFORMATION, &size, &d);
05056 
05057    if (d.FeaturesHigh & TAPE_DRIVE_WRITE_FILEMARKS)
05058       status = WriteTapemark((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_FILEMARKS, 1, FALSE);
05059    else if (d.FeaturesHigh & TAPE_DRIVE_WRITE_LONG_FMKS)
05060       status = WriteTapemark((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_LONG_FILEMARKS, 1, FALSE);
05061    else if (d.FeaturesHigh & TAPE_DRIVE_WRITE_SHORT_FMKS)
05062       status = WriteTapemark((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_SHORT_FILEMARKS, 1, FALSE);
05063    else
05064       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write_eof", "tape doesn't support writing of filemarks");
05065 
05066    if (status != NO_ERROR) {
05067       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write_eof", "unknown error %d", status);
05068       return status;
05069    }
05070 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05071 
05072    return SS_SUCCESS;
05073 }
05074 
05075 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05076 INT ss_tape_fskip(INT channel, INT count)
05077 /********************************************************************\
05078 
05079   Routine: ss_tape_fskip
05080 
05081   Purpose: Skip count number of files on a tape
05082 
05083   Input:
05084     INT   *channel          Channel identifier
05085     INT   count             Number of files to skip
05086 
05087   Output:
05088     <none>
05089 
05090   Function value:
05091     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05092     errno                   Error number
05093 
05094 \********************************************************************/
05095 {
05096 #ifdef MTIOCTOP
05097    struct mtop arg;
05098    INT status;
05099 
05100    if (count > 0)
05101       arg.mt_op = MTFSF;
05102    else
05103       arg.mt_op = MTBSF;
05104    arg.mt_count = abs(count);
05105 
05106    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
05107 
05108    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
05109 
05110    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
05111 
05112    if (status < 0) {
05113       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_fskip", strerror(errno));
05114       return errno;
05115    }
05116 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
05117 
05118 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05119    INT status;
05120 
05121    status = SetTapePosition((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_SPACE_FILEMARKS, 0, (DWORD) count, 0, FALSE);
05122 
05123    if (status == ERROR_END_OF_MEDIA)
05124       return SS_END_OF_TAPE;
05125 
05126    if (status != NO_ERROR) {
05127       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_fskip", "error %d", status);
05128       return status;
05129    }
05130 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05131 
05132    return SS_SUCCESS;
05133 }
05134 
05135 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05136 INT ss_tape_rskip(INT channel, INT count)
05137 /********************************************************************\
05138 
05139   Routine: ss_tape_rskip
05140 
05141   Purpose: Skip count number of records on a tape
05142 
05143   Input:
05144     INT   *channel          Channel identifier
05145     INT   count             Number of records to skip
05146 
05147   Output:
05148     <none>
05149 
05150   Function value:
05151     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
05152     errno                   Error number
05153 
05154 \********************************************************************/
05155 {
05156 #ifdef MTIOCTOP
05157    struct mtop arg;
05158    INT status;
05159 
05160    if (count > 0)
05161       arg.mt_op = MTFSR;
05162    else
05163       arg.mt_op = MTBSR;
05164    arg.mt_count = abs(count);
05165 
05166    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
05167 
05168    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
05169 
05170    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
05171 
05172    if (status < 0) {
05173       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_rskip", strerror(errno));
05174       return errno;
05175    }
05176 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
05177 
05178 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05179    INT status;
05180 
05181    status = SetTapePosition((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_SPACE_RELATIVE_BLOCKS, 0, (DWORD) count, 0, FALSE);
05182    if (status != NO_ERROR) {
05183       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_rskip", "error %d", status);
05184       return status;
05185    }
05186 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05187 
05188    return CM_SUCCESS;
05189 }

05246 
05247   Routine: ss_tape_spool
05248 
05249   Purpose: Spool tape forward to end of recorded data
05250

05253

05258     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion

05274    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);

05277

05279

05292       return status;
05293    }
05294 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05295 
05296    return CM_SUCCESS;
05297 }
