05410 
05411 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05412 INT ss_tape_get_blockn(INT channel)
05413 /********************************************************************\
05414 Routine: ss_tape_get_blockn
05415 Purpose: Ask the tape channel for the present block number
05416 Input:
05417 INT   *channel          Channel identifier
05418 Function value:
05419 blockn:  >0 = block number, =0 option not available, <0 errno
05420 \********************************************************************/
05421 {
05422 #if defined(OS_DARWIN)
05423 
05424    return 0;
05425 
05426 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
05427 
05428    INT status;
05429    struct mtpos arg;
05430 
05431    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
05432    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCPOS, &arg);
05433    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
05434    if (status < 0) {
05435       if (errno == EIO)
05436          return 0;
05437       else {
05438          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_get_blockn", strerror(errno));
05439          return -errno;
05440       }
05441    }
05442    return (arg.mt_blkno);
05443 
05444 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
05445 
05446    INT status;
05447    TAPE_GET_MEDIA_PARAMETERS media;
05448    unsigned long size;
05449    /* I'm not sure the partition count corresponds to the block count */
05450    status = GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_MEDIA_INFORMATION, &size, &media);
05451    return (media.PartitionCount);
05452 
05453 #endif
05454 }
05455 
05456 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05457 /********************************************************************\
05458 *                                                                    *
05459 *                     Disk functions                                 *
05460 *                                                                    *
05461 \********************************************************************/
05462 
05463 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05464 double ss_disk_free(char *path)
05465 /********************************************************************\
05466 
05467   Routine: ss_disk_free
05468 
05469   Purpose: Return free disk space
05470 
05471   Input:
05472     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05473 
05474   Output:
05475 
05476   Function value:
05477     doube                   Number of bytes free on disk
05478 
05479 \********************************************************************/
05480 {
05481 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05482 #if defined(OS_OSF1)
05483    struct statfs st;
05484    statfs(path, &st, sizeof(st));
05485    return (double) st.f_bavail * st.f_bsize;
05486 #elif defined(OS_LINUX)
05487    struct statfs st;
05488    int status;
05489    status = statfs(path, &st);
05490    if (status != 0)
05491       return -1;
05492    return (double) st.f_bavail * st.f_bsize;
05493 #elif defined(OS_SOLARIS)
05494    struct statvfs st;
05495    statvfs(path, &st);
05496    return (double) st.f_bavail * st.f_bsize;
05497 #elif defined(OS_IRIX)
05498    struct statfs st;
05499    statfs(path, &st, sizeof(struct statfs), 0);
05500    return (double) st.f_bfree * st.f_bsize;
05501 #else
05502    struct fs_data st;
05503    statfs(path, &st);
05504    return (double) st.fd_otsize * st.fd_bfree;
05505 #endif
05506 
05507 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)         /* OS_UNIX */
05508    DWORD SectorsPerCluster;
05509    DWORD BytesPerSector;
05510    DWORD NumberOfFreeClusters;
05511    DWORD TotalNumberOfClusters;
05512    char str[80];
05513 
05514    strcpy(str, path);
05515    if (strchr(str, ':') != NULL) {
05516       *(strchr(str, ':') + 1) = 0;
05517       strcat(str, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
05518       GetDiskFreeSpace(str, &SectorsPerCluster, &BytesPerSector, &NumberOfFreeClusters, &TotalNumberOfClusters);
05519    } else
05520       GetDiskFreeSpace(NULL, &SectorsPerCluster, &BytesPerSector, &NumberOfFreeClusters, &TotalNumberOfClusters);
05521 
05522    return (double) NumberOfFreeClusters *SectorsPerCluster * BytesPerSector;
05523 #else                           /* OS_WINNT */
05524 
05525    return 1e9;
05526 
05527 #endif
05528 }
05529 
05530 #if defined(OS_ULTRIX) || defined(OS_WINNT)
05531 int fnmatch(const char *pat, const char *str, const int flag)
05532 {
05533    while (*str != '\0') {
05534       if (*pat == '*') {
05535          pat++;
05536          if ((str = strchr(str, *pat)) == NULL)
05537             return -1;
05538       }
05539       if (*pat == *str) {
05540          pat++;
05541          str++;
05542       } else
05543          return -1;
05544    }
05545    if (*pat == '\0')
05546       return 0;
05547    else
05548       return -1;
05549 }
05550 #endif
05551 
05552 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05553 HANDLE pffile;
05554 LPWIN32_FIND_DATA lpfdata;
05555 #endif
05556 
05557 INT ss_file_find(char *path, char *pattern, char **plist)
05558 /********************************************************************\
05559 
05560   Routine: ss_file_find
05561 
05562   Purpose: Return list of files matching 'pattern' from the 'path' location
05563 
05564   Input:
05565     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05566     char  *pattern          pattern string (wildcard allowed)
05567 
05568   Output:
05569     char  **plist           pointer to the lfile list
05570 
05571   Function value:
05572     int                     Number of files matching request
05573 
05574 \********************************************************************/
05575 {
05576    int i;
05577 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05578    DIR *dir_pointer;
05579    struct dirent *dp;
05580 
05581    if ((dir_pointer = opendir(path)) == NULL)
05582       return 0;
05583    *plist = (char *) malloc(MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05584    i = 0;
05585    for (dp = readdir(dir_pointer); dp != NULL; dp = readdir(dir_pointer)) {
05586       if (fnmatch(pattern, dp->d_name, 0) == 0 && dp->d_type == DT_REG) {
05587          *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05588          strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), dp->d_name, strlen(dp->d_name));
05589          *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(dp->d_name)) = '\0';
05590          i++;
05591          seekdir(dir_pointer, telldir(dir_pointer));
05592       }
05593    }
05594    closedir(dir_pointer);
05595 #endif
05596 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05597    char str[255];
05598    int first;
05599 
05600    strcpy(str, path);
05601    strcat(str, "\\");
05602    strcat(str, pattern);
05603    first = 1;
05604    i = 0;
05605    lpfdata = (WIN32_FIND_DATA *) malloc(sizeof(WIN32_FIND_DATA));
05606    *plist = (char *) malloc(MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05607    pffile = FindFirstFile(str, lpfdata);
05608    if (pffile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
05609       return 0;
05610    first = 0;
05611    *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05612    strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), lpfdata->cFileName, strlen(lpfdata->cFileName));
05613    *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(lpfdata->cFileName)) = '\0';
05614    i++;
05615    while (FindNextFile(pffile, lpfdata)) {
05616       *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05617       strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), lpfdata->cFileName, strlen(lpfdata->cFileName));
05618       *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(lpfdata->cFileName)) = '\0';
05619       i++;
05620    }
05621    free(lpfdata);
05622 #endif
05623    return i;
05624 }
05625 
05626 INT ss_dir_find(char *path, char *pattern, char **plist)
05627 /********************************************************************\
05628  
05629  Routine: ss_dir_find
05630  
05631  Purpose: Return list of direcories matching 'pattern' from the 'path' location
05632  
05633  Input:
05634  char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05635  char  *pattern          pattern string (wildcard allowed)
05636  
05637  Output:
05638  char  **plist           pointer to the lfile list
05639  
05640  Function value:
05641  int                     Number of files matching request
05642  
05643  \********************************************************************/
05644 {
05645    int i;
05646 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05647    DIR *dir_pointer;
05648    struct dirent *dp;
05649    
05650    if ((dir_pointer = opendir(path)) == NULL)
05651       return 0;
05652    *plist = (char *) malloc(MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05653    i = 0;
05654    for (dp = readdir(dir_pointer); dp != NULL; dp = readdir(dir_pointer)) {
05655       if (fnmatch(pattern, dp->d_name, 0) == 0 && dp->d_type == DT_DIR) {
05656          *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05657          strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), dp->d_name, strlen(dp->d_name));
05658          *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(dp->d_name)) = '\0';
05659          i++;
05660          seekdir(dir_pointer, telldir(dir_pointer));
05661       }
05662    }
05663    closedir(dir_pointer);
05664 #endif
05665 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05666    char str[255];
05667    int first;
05668    
05669    strcpy(str, path);
05670    strcat(str, "\\");
05671    strcat(str, pattern);
05672    first = 1;
05673    i = 0;
05674    lpfdata = (WIN32_FIND_DATA *) malloc(sizeof(WIN32_FIND_DATA));
05675    *plist = (char *) malloc(MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05676    pffile = FindFirstFile(str, lpfdata);
05677    if (pffile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
05678       return 0;
05679    first = 0;
05680    *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05681    strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), lpfdata->cFileName, strlen(lpfdata->cFileName));
05682    *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(lpfdata->cFileName)) = '\0';
05683    i++;
05684    while (FindNextFile(pffile, lpfdata)) {
05685       *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05686       strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), lpfdata->cFileName, strlen(lpfdata->cFileName));
05687       *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(lpfdata->cFileName)) = '\0';
05688       i++;
05689    }
05690    free(lpfdata);
05691 #endif
05692    return i;
05693 }
05694 
05695 INT ss_file_remove(char *path)
05696 /********************************************************************\
05697 
05698   Routine: ss_file_remove
05699 
05700   Purpose: remove (delete) file given through the path
05701 
05702   Input:
05703     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05704 
05705   Output:
05706 
05707   Function value:
05708     int                     function error 0= ok, -1 check errno
05709 
05710 \********************************************************************/
05711 {
05712    return remove(path);
05713 }
05714 
05715 double ss_file_size(char *path)
05716 /********************************************************************\
05717 
05718   Routine: ss_file_size
05719 
05720   Purpose: Return file size in bytes for the given path
05721 
05722   Input:
05723     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05724 
05725   Output:
05726 
05727   Function value:
05728     double                     File size
05729 
05730 \********************************************************************/
05731 {
05732 #ifdef _LARGEFILE64_SOURCE
05733    struct stat64 stat_buf;
05734    int status;
05735 
05736    /* allocate buffer with file size */
05737    status = stat64(path, &stat_buf);
05738    if (status != 0)
05739       return -1;
05740    return (double) stat_buf.st_size;
05741 #else
05742    struct stat stat_buf;
05743    int status;
05744 
05745    /* allocate buffer with file size */
05746    status = stat(path, &stat_buf);
05747    if (status != 0)
05748       return -1;
05749    return (double) stat_buf.st_size;
05750 #endif
05751 }
05752 
05753 double ss_disk_size(char *path)
05754 /********************************************************************\
05755 
05756   Routine: ss_disk_size
05757 
05758   Purpose: Return full disk space
05759 
05760   Input:
05761     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05762 
05763   Output:
05764 
05765   Function value:
05766     doube                   Number of bytes free on disk
05767 
05768 \********************************************************************/
05769 {
05770 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05771 #if defined(OS_OSF1)
05772    struct statfs st;
05773    statfs(path, &st, sizeof(st));
05774    return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_fsize;
05775 #elif defined(OS_LINUX)
05776    int status;
05777    struct statfs st;
05778    status = statfs(path, &st);
05779    if (status != 0)
05780       return -1;
05781    return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_bsize;
05782 #elif defined(OS_SOLARIS)
05783    struct statvfs st;
05784    statvfs(path, &st);
05785    if (st.f_frsize > 0)
05786       return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_frsize;
05787    else
05788       return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_bsize;
05789 #elif defined(OS_ULTRIX)
05790    struct fs_data st;
05791    statfs(path, &st);
05792    return (double) st.fd_btot * 1024;
05793 #elif defined(OS_IRIX)
05794    struct statfs st;
05795    statfs(path, &st, sizeof(struct statfs), 0);
05796    return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_bsize;
05797 #else
05798 #error ss_disk_size not defined for this OS
05799 #endif
05800 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
05801 
05802 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05803    DWORD SectorsPerCluster;
05804    DWORD BytesPerSector;
05805    DWORD NumberOfFreeClusters;
05806    DWORD TotalNumberOfClusters;
05807    char str[80];
05808 
05809    strcpy(str, path);
05810    if (strchr(str, ':') != NULL) {
05811       *(strchr(str, ':') + 1) = 0;
05812       strcat(str, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
05813       GetDiskFreeSpace(str, &SectorsPerCluster, &BytesPerSector, &NumberOfFreeClusters, &TotalNumberOfClusters);
05814    } else
05815       GetDiskFreeSpace(NULL, &SectorsPerCluster, &BytesPerSector, &NumberOfFreeClusters, &TotalNumberOfClusters);
05816 
05817    return (double) TotalNumberOfClusters *SectorsPerCluster * BytesPerSector;
05818 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05819 
05820    return 1e9;
05821 }
05822 
05823 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05824 /********************************************************************\
05825 *                                                                    *
05826 *                  Screen  functions                                 *
05827 *                                                                    *
05828 \********************************************************************/
05829 
05830 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05831 void ss_clear_screen()
05832 /********************************************************************\
05833 
05834   Routine: ss_clear_screen
05835 
05836   Purpose: Clear the screen
05837 
05838   Input:
05839     <none>
05840 
05841   Output:
05842     <none>
05843 
05844   Function value:
05845     <none>
05846 
05847 \********************************************************************/
05848 {
05849 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05850 
05851    HANDLE hConsole;
05852    COORD coordScreen = { 0, 0 };        /* here's where we'll home the cursor */
05853    BOOL bSuccess;
05854    DWORD cCharsWritten;
05855    CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbi;     /* to get buffer info */
05856    DWORD dwConSize;             /* number of character cells in the current buffer */
05857 
05858    hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
05859 
05860    /* get the number of character cells in the current buffer */
05861    bSuccess = GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(hConsole, &csbi);
05862    dwConSize = csbi.dwSize.X * csbi.dwSize.Y;
05863 
05864    /* fill the entire screen with blanks */
05865    bSuccess = FillConsoleOutputCharacter(hConsole, (TCHAR) ' ', dwConSize, coordScreen, &cCharsWritten);
05866 
05867    /* put the cursor at (0, 0) */
05868    bSuccess = SetConsoleCursorPosition(hConsole, coordScreen);
05869    return;
05870 
05871 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05872 #if defined(OS_UNIX) || defined(OS_VXWORKS) || defined(OS_VMS)
05873    printf("\033[2J");
05874 #endif
05875 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
05876    clrscr();
05877 #endif
05878 }
05879 
05880 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05881 void ss_set_screen_size(int x, int y)
05882 /********************************************************************\
05883 
05884   Routine: ss_set_screen_size
05885 
05886   Purpose: Set the screen size in character cells
05887 
05888   Input:
05889     <none>
05890 
05891   Output:
05892     <none>
05893 
05894   Function value:
05895     <none>
05896 
05897 \********************************************************************/
05898 {
05899 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05900 
05901    HANDLE hConsole;
05902    COORD coordSize;
05903 
05904    coordSize.X = (short) x;
05905    coordSize.Y = (short) y;
05906    hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
05907    SetConsoleScreenBufferSize(hConsole, coordSize);
05908 
05909 #else                           /* OS_WINNT */
05910    int i;
05911    i = x;                       /* avoid compiler warning */
05912    i = y;
05913 #endif
05914 }
05915 
05916 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05917 void ss_printf(INT x, INT y, const char *format, ...)
05918 /********************************************************************\
05919 
05920   Routine: ss_printf
05921 
05922   Purpose: Print string at given cursor position
05923 
05924   Input:
05925     INT   x,y               Cursor position, starting from zero,
05926           x=0 and y=0 left upper corner
05927 
05928     char  *format           Format string for printf
05929     ...                     Arguments for printf
05930 
05931   Output:
05932     <none>
05933 
05934   Function value:
05935     <none>
05936 
05937 \********************************************************************/
05938 {
05939    char str[256];
05940    va_list argptr;
05941 
05942    va_start(argptr, format);
05943    vsprintf(str, (char *) format, argptr);
05944    va_end(argptr);
05945 
05946 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05947    {
05948       HANDLE hConsole;
05949       COORD dwWriteCoord;
05950       DWORD cCharsWritten;
05951 
05952       hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
05953 
05954       dwWriteCoord.X = (short) x;
05955       dwWriteCoord.Y = (short) y;
05956 
05957       WriteConsoleOutputCharacter(hConsole, str, strlen(str), dwWriteCoord, &cCharsWritten);
05958    }
05959 
05960 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05961 
05962 #if defined(OS_UNIX) || defined(OS_VXWORKS) || defined(OS_VMS)
05963    printf("\033[%1d;%1dH", y + 1, x + 1);
05964    printf("%s", str);
05965    fflush(stdout);
05966 #endif
05967 
05968 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
05969    gotoxy(x + 1, y + 1);
05970    cputs(str);
05971 #endif
05972 }
05973 
05974 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05975 char *ss_getpass(char *prompt)
05976 /********************************************************************\
05977 
05978   Routine: ss_getpass
05979 
05980   Purpose: Read password without echoing it at the screen
05981 
05982   Input:
05983     char   *prompt    Prompt string
05984 
05985   Output:
05986     <none>
05987 
05988   Function value:
05989     char*             Pointer to password
05990 
05991 \********************************************************************/
05992 {
05993    static char password[32];
05994 
05995    printf("%s", prompt);
05996    memset(password, 0, sizeof(password));
05997 
05998 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05999    return (char *) getpass("");
06000 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
06001    {
06002       HANDLE hConsole;
06003       DWORD nCharsRead;
06004 
06005       hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
06006       SetConsoleMode(hConsole, ENABLE_LINE_INPUT);
06007       ReadConsole(hConsole, password, sizeof(password), &nCharsRead, NULL);
06008       SetConsoleMode(hConsole, ENABLE_LINE_INPUT | ENABLE_ECHO_INPUT | ENABLE_PROCESSED_INPUT | ENABLE_MOUSE_INPUT);
06009       printf("\n");
06010 
06011       if (password[strlen(password) - 1] == '\r')
06012          password[strlen(password) - 1] = 0;
06013 
06014       return password;
06015    }
06016 #elif defined(OS_MSDOS)
06017    {
06018       char c, *ptr;
06019 
06020       ptr = password;
06021       while ((c = getchar()) != EOF && c != '\n')
06022          *ptr++ = c;
06023       *ptr = 0;
06024 
06025       printf("\n");
06026       return password;
06027    }
06028 #else
06029    {
06030       ss_gets(password, 32);
06031       return password;
06032    }
06033 #endif
06034 }
06035 
06036 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06037 INT ss_getchar(BOOL reset)
06038 /********************************************************************\
06039 
06040   Routine: ss_getchar
06041 
06042   Purpose: Read a single character
06043 
06044   Input:
06045     BOOL   reset            Reset terminal to standard mode
06046 
06047   Output:
06048     <none>
06049 
06050   Function value:
06051     int             0       for no character available
06052                     CH_xxs  for special character
06053                     n       ASCII code for normal character
06054                     -1      function not available on this OS
06055 
06056 \********************************************************************/
06057 {
06058 #ifdef OS_UNIX
06059 
06060    static BOOL init = FALSE;
06061    static struct termios save_termios;
06062    struct termios buf;
06063    int i, fd;
06064    char c[3];
06065 
06066    if (_daemon_flag)
06067       return 0;
06068 
06069    fd = fileno(stdin);
06070 
06071    if (reset) {
06072       if (init)
06073          tcsetattr(fd, TCSAFLUSH, &save_termios);
06074       init = FALSE;
06075       return 0;
06076    }
06077 
06078    if (!init) {
06079       tcgetattr(fd, &save_termios);
06080       memcpy(&buf, &save_termios, sizeof(buf));
06081 
06082       buf.c_lflag &= ~(ECHO | ICANON | IEXTEN);
06083 
06084       buf.c_iflag &= ~(ICRNL | INPCK | ISTRIP | IXON);
06085 
06086       buf.c_cflag &= ~(CSIZE | PARENB);
06087       buf.c_cflag |= CS8;
06088       /* buf.c_oflag &= ~(OPOST); */
06089       buf.c_cc[VMIN] = 0;
06090       buf.c_cc[VTIME] = 0;
06091 
06092       tcsetattr(fd, TCSAFLUSH, &buf);
06093       init = TRUE;
06094    }
06095 
06096    memset(c, 0, 3);
06097    i = read(fd, c, 1);
06098 
06099    if (i == 0)
06100       return 0;
06101 
06102    /* check if ESC */
06103    if (c[0] == 27) {
06104       i = read(fd, c, 2);
06105       if (i == 0)               /* return if only ESC */
06106          return 27;
06107 
06108       /* cursor keys return 2 chars, others 3 chars */
06109       if (c[1] < 65)
06110          read(fd, c, 1);
06111 
06112       /* convert ESC sequence to CH_xxx */
06113       switch (c[1]) {
06114       case 49:
06115          return CH_HOME;
06116       case 50:
06117          return CH_INSERT;
06118       case 51:
06119          return CH_DELETE;
06120       case 52:
06121          return CH_END;
06122       case 53:
06123          return CH_PUP;
06124       case 54:
06125          return CH_PDOWN;
06126       case 65:
06127          return CH_UP;
06128       case 66:
06129          return CH_DOWN;
06130       case 67:
06131          return CH_RIGHT;
06132       case 68:
06133          return CH_LEFT;
06134       }
06135    }
06136 
06137    /* BS/DEL -> BS */
06138    if (c[0] == 127)
06139       return CH_BS;
06140 
06141    return c[0];
06142 
06143 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
06144 
06145    static BOOL init = FALSE;
06146    static INT repeat_count = 0;
06147    static INT repeat_char;
06148    HANDLE hConsole;
06149    DWORD nCharsRead;
06150    INPUT_RECORD ir;
06151    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
06152 
06153    /* find out if we are under W95 */
06154    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
06155    GetVersionEx(&vi);
06156 
06157    if (vi.dwPlatformId != VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
06158       /* under W95, console doesn't work properly */
06159       int c;
06160 
06161       if (!kbhit())
06162          return 0;
06163 
06164       c = getch();
06165       if (c == 224) {
06166          c = getch();
06167          switch (c) {
06168          case 71:
06169             return CH_HOME;
06170          case 72:
06171             return CH_UP;
06172          case 73:
06173             return CH_PUP;
06174          case 75:
06175             return CH_LEFT;
06176          case 77:
06177             return CH_RIGHT;
06178          case 79:
06179             return CH_END;
06180          case 80:
06181             return CH_DOWN;
06182          case 81:
06183             return CH_PDOWN;
06184          case 82:
06185             return CH_INSERT;
06186          case 83:
06187             return CH_DELETE;
06188          }
06189       }
06190       return c;
06191    }
06192 
06193    hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
06194 
06195    if (reset) {
06196       SetConsoleMode(hConsole, ENABLE_LINE_INPUT | ENABLE_ECHO_INPUT | ENABLE_PROCESSED_INPUT | ENABLE_MOUSE_INPUT);
06197       init = FALSE;
06198       return 0;
06199    }
06200 
06201    if (!init) {
06202       SetConsoleMode(hConsole, ENABLE_PROCESSED_INPUT);
06203       init = TRUE;
06204    }
06205 
06206    if (repeat_count) {
06207       repeat_count--;
06208       return repeat_char;
06209    }
06210 
06211    PeekConsoleInput(hConsole, &ir, 1, &nCharsRead);
06212 
06213    if (nCharsRead == 0)
06214       return 0;
06215 
06216    ReadConsoleInput(hConsole, &ir, 1, &nCharsRead);
06217 
06218    if (ir.EventType != KEY_EVENT)
06219       return ss_getchar(0);
06220 
06221    if (!ir.Event.KeyEvent.bKeyDown)
06222       return ss_getchar(0);
06223 
06224    if (ir.Event.KeyEvent.wRepeatCount > 1) {
06225       repeat_count = ir.Event.KeyEvent.wRepeatCount - 1;
06226       repeat_char = ir.Event.KeyEvent.uChar.AsciiChar;
06227       return repeat_char;
06228    }
06229 
06230    if (ir.Event.KeyEvent.uChar.AsciiChar)
06231       return ir.Event.KeyEvent.uChar.AsciiChar;
06232 
06233    if (ir.Event.KeyEvent.dwControlKeyState & (ENHANCED_KEY)) {
06234       switch (ir.Event.KeyEvent.wVirtualKeyCode) {
06235       case 33:
06236          return CH_PUP;
06237       case 34:
06238          return CH_PDOWN;
06239       case 35:
06240          return CH_END;
06241       case 36:
06242          return CH_HOME;
06243       case 37:
06244          return CH_LEFT;
06245       case 38:
06246          return CH_UP;
06247       case 39:
06248          return CH_RIGHT;
06249       case 40:
06250          return CH_DOWN;
06251       case 45:
06252          return CH_INSERT;
06253       case 46:
06254          return CH_DELETE;
06255       }
06256 
06257       return ir.Event.KeyEvent.wVirtualKeyCode;
06258    }
06259 
06260    return ss_getchar(0);
06261 
06262 #elif defined(OS_MSDOS)
06263 
06264    int c;
06265 
06266    if (!kbhit())
06267       return 0;
06268 
06269    c = getch();
06270    if (!c) {
06271       c = getch();
06272       switch (c) {
06273       case 71:
06274          return CH_HOME;
06275       case 72:
06276          return CH_UP;
06277       case 73:
06278          return CH_PUP;
06279       case 75:
06280          return CH_LEFT;
06281       case 77:
06282          return CH_RIGHT;
06283       case 79:
06284          return CH_END;
06285       case 80:
06286          return CH_DOWN;
06287       case 81:
06288          return CH_PDOWN;
06289       case 82:
06290          return CH_INSERT;
06291       case 83:
06292          return CH_DELETE;
06293       }
06294    }
06295    return c;
06296 
06297 #else
06298    return -1;
06299 #endif
06300 }
06301 
06302 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06303 char *ss_gets(char *string, int size)
06304 /********************************************************************\
06305 
06306   Routine: ss_gets
06307 
06308   Purpose: Read a line from standard input. Strip trailing new line
06309            character. Return in a loop so that it cannot be interrupted
06310            by an alarm() signal (like under Sun Solaris)
06311 
06312   Input:
06313     INT    size             Size of string
06314 
06315   Output:
06316     BOOL   string           Return string
06317 
06318   Function value:
06319     char                    Return string
06320 
06321 \********************************************************************/
06322 {
06323    char *p;
06324 
06325    do {
06326       p = fgets(string, size, stdin);
06327    } while (p == NULL);
06328 
06329 
06330    if (strlen(p) > 0 && p[strlen(p) - 1] == '\n')
06331       p[strlen(p) - 1] = 0;
06332 
06333    return p;
06334 }
06335 
06336 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06337 /********************************************************************\
06338 *                                                                    *
06339 *                  Direct IO functions                               *
06340 *                                                                    *
06341 \********************************************************************/
06342 
06343 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06344 INT ss_directio_give_port(INT start, INT end)
06345 {
06346 #ifdef OS_WINNT
06347 
06348    /* under Windows NT, use DirectIO driver to open ports */
06349 
06350    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
06351    HANDLE hdio = 0;
06352    DWORD buffer[] = { 6, 0, 0, 0 };
06353    DWORD size;
06354 
06355    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
06356    GetVersionEx(&vi);
06357 
06358    /* use DirectIO driver under NT to gain port access */
06359    if (vi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
06360       hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
06361       if (hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
06362          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot access IO ports (No DirectIO driver installed)\n");
06363          return -1;
06364       }
06365 
06366       /* open ports */
06367       buffer[1] = start;
06368       buffer[2] = end;
06369       if (!DeviceIoControl(hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer), NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
06370          return -1;
06371    }
06372 
06373    return SS_SUCCESS;
06374 #else
06375    int i;
06376    i = start;                   /* avoid compiler warning */
06377    i = end;
06378    return SS_SUCCESS;
06379 #endif
06380 }
06381 
06382 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06383 INT ss_directio_lock_port(INT start, INT end)
06384 {
06385 #ifdef OS_WINNT
06386 
06387    /* under Windows NT, use DirectIO driver to lock ports */
06388 
06389    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
06390    HANDLE hdio;
06391    DWORD buffer[] = { 7, 0, 0, 0 };
06392    DWORD size;
06393 
06394    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
06395    GetVersionEx(&vi);
06396 
06397    /* use DirectIO driver under NT to gain port access */
06398    if (vi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
06399       hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
06400       if (hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
06401          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot access IO ports (No DirectIO driver installed)\n");
06402          return -1;
06403       }
06404 
06405       /* lock ports */
06406       buffer[1] = start;
06407       buffer[2] = end;
06408       if (!DeviceIoControl(hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer), NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
06409          return -1;
06410    }
06411 
06412    return SS_SUCCESS;
06413 #else
06414    int i;
06415    i = start;                   /* avoid compiler warning */
06416    i = end;
06417    return SS_SUCCESS;
06418 #endif
06419 }
06420 
06421 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06422 /********************************************************************\
06423 *                                                                    *
06424 *                  System logging                                    *
06425 *                                                                    *
06426 \********************************************************************/
06427 
06428 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06429 INT ss_syslog(const char *message)
06430 /********************************************************************\
06431 
06432   Routine: ss_syslog
06433 
06434   Purpose: Write a message to the system logging facility
06435 
06436   Input:
06437     char   format  Same as for printf
06438 
06439   Output:
06440     <none>
06441 
06442   Function value:
06443     SS_SUCCESS     Successful completion
06444 
06445 \********************************************************************/
06446 {
06447 #ifdef OS_UNIX
06448    static BOOL init = FALSE;
06449 
06450    if (!init) {
06451 #ifdef OS_ULTRIX
06452       openlog("MIDAS", LOG_PID);
06453 #else
06454       openlog("MIDAS", LOG_PID, LOG_USER);
06455 #endif
06456       init = TRUE;
06457    }
06458 
06459    syslog(LOG_DEBUG, message, 0);
06460    return SS_SUCCESS;
06461 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)         /* OS_UNIX */
06462 /*
06463 HANDLE hlog = 0;
06464 const char *pstr[2];
06465 
06466   if (!hlog)
06467     {
06468     HKEY  hk;
06469     DWORD d;
06470     char  str[80];
06471 
06472     RegCreateKey(HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE,
06473       "SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\EventLog\\Application\\Midas", &hk);
06474 
06475     strcpy(str, (char *) rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_NAME));
06476     RegSetValueEx(hk, "EventMessageFile", 0, REG_EXPAND_SZ, (LPBYTE) str, strlen(str) + 1);
06477 
06478     d = EVENTLOG_ERROR_TYPE | EVENTLOG_WARNING_TYPE |
06479         EVENTLOG_INFORMATION_TYPE;
06480     RegSetValueEx(hk, "TypesSupported", 0, REG_DWORD, (LPBYTE) &d, sizeof(DWORD));
06481     RegCloseKey(hk);
06482 
06483     hlog = RegisterEventSource(NULL, "Midas");
06484     }
06485 
06486   pstr[0] = message;
06487   pstr[1] = NULL;
06488 
06489   if (hlog)
06490     ReportEvent(hlog, EVENTLOG_INFORMATION_TYPE, 0, 0, NULL, 1, 0, pstr, NULL);
06491 */
06492    return SS_SUCCESS;
06493 
06494 #else                           /* OS_WINNT */
06495 
06496    return SS_SUCCESS;
06497 
06498 #endif
06499 }
06500 
06501 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06502 /********************************************************************\
06503 *                                                                    *
06504 *                  Encryption                                        *
06505 *                                                                    *
06506 \********************************************************************/
06507 
06508 #define bin_to_ascii(c) ((c)>=38?((c)-38+'a'):(c)>=12?((c)-12+'A'):(c)+'.')
06509 
06510 char *ss_crypt(const char *buf, const char *salt)
06511 /********************************************************************\
06512 
06513   Routine: ss_crypt
06514 
06515   Purpose: Simple fake of UNIX crypt(3) function, until we get
06516            a better one
06517 
06518   Input:
06519     char   *buf             Plain password
06520     char   *slalt           Two random characters
06521                             events. Can be used to skip events
06522 
06523   Output:
06524     <none>
06525 
06526   Function value:
06527     char*                   Encrypted password
06528 
06529 \********************************************************************/
06530 {
06531    int i, seed;
06532    static char enc_pw[13];
06533 
06534    memset(enc_pw, 0, sizeof(enc_pw));
06535    enc_pw[0] = salt[0];
06536    enc_pw[1] = salt[1];
06537 
06538    for (i = 0; i < 8 && buf[i]; i++)
06539       enc_pw[i + 2] = buf[i];
06540    for (; i < 8; i++)
06541       enc_pw[i + 2] = 0;
06542 
06543    seed = 123;
06544    for (i = 2; i < 13; i++) {
06545       seed = 5 * seed + 27 + enc_pw[i];
06546       enc_pw[i] = (char) bin_to_ascii(seed & 0x3F);
06547    }
06548 
06549    return enc_pw;
06550 }
06551 
06552 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06553 /********************************************************************\
06554 *                                                                    *
06555 *                  NaN's                                             *
06556 *                                                                    *
06557 \********************************************************************/
06558 
06559 double ss_nan()
06560 {
06561    double nan;
06562 
06563    nan = 0;
06564    nan = 0 / nan;
06565    return nan;
06566 }
06567 
06568 #ifdef OS_WINNT
06569 #include <float.h>
06570 #ifndef isnan
06571 #define isnan(x) _isnan(x)
06572 #endif
06573 #ifndef finite
06574 #define finite(x) _finite(x)
06575 #endif
06576 #elif defined(OS_LINUX)
06577 #include <math.h>
06578 #endif
06579 
06580 int ss_isnan(double x)
06581 {
06582    return isnan(x);
06583 }
06584 
06585 int ss_isfin(double x)
06586 {
06587    return finite(x);
06588 }
06589 
06590 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
06591 /********************************************************************\
06592 *                                                                    *
06593 *                  Stack Trace                                       *
06594 *                                                                    *
06595 \********************************************************************/
06596 
06597 #ifdef OS_LINUX
06598 #include <execinfo.h>
06599 #endif
06600 
06601 #define N_STACK_HISTORY 500
06602 char stack_history[N_STACK_HISTORY][80];
06603 int stack_history_pointer = -1;
06604 
06605 INT ss_stack_get(char ***string)
06606 {
06607 #ifdef OS_LINUX
06608 #define MAX_STACK_DEPTH 16
06609 
06610    void *trace[MAX_STACK_DEPTH];
06611    int size;
06612 
06613    size = backtrace(trace, MAX_STACK_DEPTH);
06614    *string = backtrace_symbols(trace, size);
06615    return size;
06616 #else
06617    return 0;
06618 #endif
06619 }
06620 
06621 void ss_stack_print()
06622 {
06623    char **string;
06624    int i, n;
06625 
06626    n = ss_stack_get(&string);
06627    for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
06628       printf("%s\n", string[i]);
06629    if (n > 0)
06630       free(string);
06631 }
06632 
06633 void ss_stack_history_entry(char *tag)
06634 {
06635    char **string;
06636    int i, n;
06637 
06638    if (stack_history_pointer == -1) {
06639       stack_history_pointer++;
06640       memset(stack_history, 0, sizeof(stack_history));
06641    }
06642    strlcpy(stack_history[stack_history_pointer], tag, 80);
06643    stack_history_pointer = (stack_history_pointer + 1) % N_STACK_HISTORY;
06644    n = ss_stack_get(&string);
06645    for (i = 2; i < n; i++) {
06646       strlcpy(stack_history[stack_history_pointer], string[i], 80);
06647       stack_history_pointer = (stack_history_pointer + 1) % N_STACK_HISTORY;
06648    }
06649    free(string);
06650 
06651    strlcpy(stack_history[stack_history_pointer], "=========================", 80);
06652    stack_history_pointer = (stack_history_pointer + 1) % N_STACK_HISTORY;
06653 }
06654 
06655 void ss_stack_history_dump(char *filename)
06656 {
06657    FILE *f;
06658    int i, j;
06659 
06660    f = fopen(filename, "wt");
06661    if (f != NULL) {
06662       j = stack_history_pointer;
06663       for (i = 0; i < N_STACK_HISTORY; i++) {
06664          if (strlen(stack_history[j]) > 0)
06665             fprintf(f, "%s\n", stack_history[j]);
06666          j = (j + 1) % N_STACK_HISTORY;
06667       }
06668       fclose(f);
06669       printf("Stack dump written to %s\n", filename);
06670    } else
06671       printf("Cannot open %s: errno=%d\n", filename, errno);
06672 }
06673 
06674 /**dox***************************************************************/
06675 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */

06678          /** @} *//* end of msystemincludecode */
